The brands and formulas we&#39;ve highlighted here are a sampling of the many excellent options available, and each recommendation was evaluated based on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dog-food#aafco-standards-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">standards established by the Association of American Feed Control Officials (AAFCO)</a> as well as consultation with veterinary experts. (Products have been independently chosen by us based on our research and years of experience; none were recommended by our experts who maintain impartiality.) </p><p>The advice in this guide is tailored to the &#34;average dog&#34; - a sedentary or moderately active dog that is either a healthy weight or slightly overweight, does not have a specific health condition, and is not a working or performance dog. Each dog food was evaluated based on its nutritional adequacy, calorie content, guaranteed analysis, and ingredients. </p><p>At the end of this guide, you&#39;ll find complete details on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dog-food#our-methodology-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">our methodology</a> and the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dog-food#our-sources-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">experts we spoke with</a>, as well as information on how to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dog-food#how-to-read-a-pet-food-label-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">read a pet food label</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dog-food#our-methodology-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">calculate your dog&#39;s caloric needs</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dog-food#faqs-about-dog-food-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">find a food your dog likes to eat</a>. You can also use this knowledge to evaluate any other brands you might be interested in trying. </p><p>Not all dogs are the same, so always consult your veterinarian before introducing new foods to their diets.</p><h2>Here are 21 of the best dog foods you can buy in 2021</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Dry dog food: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fpurina-beyond-superfood-blend-wild%2Fdp%2F106870\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Purina Beyond Superfood Blend</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fmerrick-classic-healthy-grains-real%2Fdp%2F121736\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Merrick Classic Healthy Grains</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fnatures-logic-canine-chicken-meal%2Fdp%2F244536\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nature&#39;s Logic Canine Chicken Meal Feast</a></li><li><strong>Wet dog food: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fgo-skin-coat-care-pollock-pate-dog%2Fdp%2F246647\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Go! Grain-Free Senior Trout and Sweet Potato Recipe</a></li></ul><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Updated on 4/02/2021: </strong>We rewrote this guide and selected new picks based on extensive research and reporting.</p></aside>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best adult dry dog food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606776c7856cd700198a2fb1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Adult Dry\" height=\"1249\" width=\"1666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chewy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Dry dog food is a practical option for many pet owners: It's cost-effective, has a long shelf life, and is easy to store and serve. Always check a pet food label to ensure the food is AAFCO complete and balanced for your adult dog's life stage &#8212; \"maintenance\" for adults and \"growth\" for puppies and pregnant or lactating females.&#160;</p><p>For adult dogs, we recommend foods containing moderate protein (the AAFCO minimum is 18% for adults) and low to moderate fat. Pet owners often assume more protein is better since dogs evolved as carnivores, but this is not so, according to Kelly Swanson, PhD, professor of animal and nutritional sciences at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Domestic dogs are actually omnivorous and do not require extremely high protein concentrations in their diet. \"From a pet health perspective, the protein quality and digestibility are most important,\" he said.</p><p>When shopping for dog food, look for meat sources of protein such as whole meats and meat meals at the top of the ingredients list. Complementary proteins like rice and beans may also be included.&#160;Swanson likes to see fat concentrations below 20%, although he doesn't get too concerned about fat content for healthy-weight pets who do not have conditions like pancreatitis or gastrointestinal disease.</p><p>Veterinarian W. Jean Dodds, owner of Hemopet Holistic Care Veterinary Clinic, looks for a variety of nutrient-dense whole foods on the list. These include high quality meats or fish, some carbohydrates, a mixture of vegetables, and some fruit, including berries.&#160;</p><p>Many foods also contain extra ingredients like omega fatty acids for skin and coat health, probiotics for digestion, and glucosamine, chondroitin, and green-lipped mussels for joint support.</p><h3>Our picks for adult dry dog food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box adult wet dog food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606776f3856cd700198a2fb4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Wet Food\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chewy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Wet food is particularly appealing to dogs. Pet parents often like it for this reason, and because it has a long shelf life when unopened.&#160;</p><p>We selected wet foods that meet AAFCO complete and balanced standards, which are the same as those that apply to dry food. However, wet food generally contains more protein and fat and fewer carbohydrates, so be sure to talk to your veterinarian before switching your dog to a wet diet, especially if they have trouble digesting a lot of protein or fat.</p><p>Although the same standards apply to dry and wet food, it can be hard to compare their labels. Kibble has very little moisture, while canned food contains a lot of water. To understand a wet food label, you need to look at the percentages of protein, fat, and fiber on a \"dry matter basis.\" Read these <a href=\"https://vetnutrition.tufts.edu/2017/08/nutrient_converter/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">instructions</a> from the Cummings Veterinary Medical Center at Tufts University to calculate them yourself, call the food manufacturer, or ask your veterinarian for help. For the foods below, we contacted the manufacturer.</p><p>When shopping, be on the lookout for wet dog food that is 100% meat. More protein might seem like a good thing, but these foods are for supplemental feeding only. \"Dogs have evolved from wolves to become obligate omnivores,\" said Dodds. This means that they need more than just meat in their diet. Small amounts of meat-only wet foods can make tasty meal toppers for your dog's complete and balanced dry food.</p><h3>Our picks for adult wet dog food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fgo-skin-coat-care-pollock-pate-dog%2Fdp%2F246647\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Go! Limited Ingredient Diet Grain-Free Lamb and Potato Recipe (12.5 oz.-cans, 12-pack)<br /></a><strong>Single protein source:</strong> Lamb, including lamb liver<br /><strong>Single carbohydrate kcal/12.5-ounce (about 40 calories per ounce)<br /><strong>What else you should know:</strong> This limited-ingredient food may be good for dogs with allergies that need to avoid certain ingredients. The FDA continues to investigate a potential link between dogs fed grain-free diets and the development of dilated cardiomyopathy, so talk to your veterinarian before feeding your dog this food.<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"606730b13d35010018fe0f99\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Limited Ingredient Diet Grain-Free Lamb and Potato Recipe (12.5 oz.-cans, 12-pack) (button)</bi-shortcode></aside>\n\tThe best fresh dog food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6067770da7d803001963e930?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Fresh Food\" height=\"1249\" width=\"1666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ollie; Just Food for Dogs; The Farmer&#39;s Dog</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Fresh dog food is minimally processed, made with wholesome ingredients, often without preservatives, and cooked a short time before your dog eats it. All this means fresh dog food is some of the most expensive food you can buy.</p><p>Some dog food companies cook fresh, individually customized food and ship it directly to your door, usually via a subscription. It must be stored in the freezer, thawed in the refrigerator, and fed within a few days of opening the package.&#160;</p><p>Always check that the fresh food you plan to feed your dog is AAFCO complete and balanced and not intended for supplemental feeding. Most companies tailor the calorie content of the meals to your specific dog based on weight, breed, and activity level.&#160;</p><p>When choosing a healthy fresh dog food, look for the same beneficial ingredients you would for any dog food: meat sources of protein, whole grains, fruits, vegetables, marine sources of fat, and healthy extras like omega fatty acids, glucosamine, chondroitin, and probiotics.</p><h3>Our picks for fresh dog food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><a Food made from organic, non-GMO, or human-grade ingredients comes with a premium price tag.&#160;</p><p>The good news is, it's not necessary to go broke to feed your dog a great diet. If you're looking to spend less, many high-quality dog foods provide excellent nutrition at a lower cost.&#160;</p><p>We don't advise buying the cheapest food available &#8212; to keep the price down, such foods contain lower-quality ingredients and more fillers. As with any diet, choose the appropriate food for your dog's life stage and check for the AAFCO complete and balanced statement on the label.</p><h3>Our picks for budget dog food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fwhole-earth-farms-adult-recipe-dry%2Fdp%2F163882\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Whole Earth Farms Adult Recipe (25-lb. bag)<br /></a><strong>Main protein sources:</strong> Chicken meal, turkey meal<br /><strong>Standout carbohydrates:</strong> Brown rice, oatmeal, barley, peas, apples<br /><strong>Healthy extras:</strong> Omega fatty acids (salmon oil)<br /><strong>Feeding trials:</strong> No<br /><strong>Best for:</strong> Moderately active, normal-weight dogs<br /><strong>Nutrition breakdown:</strong> 26% protein, 14% fat, 3.5% fiber<br /><strong>Calorie count:</strong> 376 kcal/cup<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6067426e3d35010018fe0fbb\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Original Ultra Chicken, Chicken Meal, and Duck Meal Formula (30-lb. bag) (button)</bi-shortcode></aside>\n\tThe best grain-free dog food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677740a7d803001963e934?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Grain Free\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chewy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Grain-free diets aren't necessarily superior to diets that contain grains, but they can be helpful for dogs that are allergic or intolerant to specific grains. There is also a misconception that these dog foods are carbohydrate-free, but the necessary carbohydrates just come from non-grain ingredients like white potatoes, sweet potatoes, peas, lentils, chickpeas, soybeans, and tapioca.</p><p>Something worth mentioning in any discussion about grain-free food is the fact that the <a href=\"https://www.fda.gov/animal-veterinary/outbreaks-and-advisories/fda-investigation-potential-link-between-certain-diets-and-canine-dilated-cardiomyopathy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FDA continues to investigate</a> a potential link between dogs fed grain-free diets and the development of a heart condition called non-hereditary dilated cardiomyopathy. For now, no firm correlation between grain-free diets and cardiac issues has been scientifically supported. However, it's possible we may discover more in the future. Always talk to your veterinarian about feeding your dog a grain-free diet.</p><h3>Our picks for grain-free dog food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Forijen-fit-trim-grain-free-dry-dog%2Fdp%2F285963\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Orijen Fit food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677762856cd700198a2fb9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Puppy\" height=\"1251\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chewy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Puppy foods are formulated to be energy-dense, which means they are higher in fat and calories to fuel growing bodies.&#160;</p><p>To ensure the food you're considering is appropriate for puppies, check the label for an AAFCO complete and balanced statement that says it's intended for growth for all life stages. A food labeled \"maintenance\" is only intended for adult dogs.</p><p>Some puppy foods are made specially for small breeds or large and giant breeds, but there aren't any official AAFCO nutrient standards for these designations. \"Balancing the nutrient needs of dogs given their wide size variety and ages is wise and common sense,\" said Dodds.</p><p>Small breed puppy foods usually have a smaller kibble size for smaller mouths and are often slightly higher in calories to account for the higher metabolisms of these breeds. Puppy foods for large and giant breeds generally contain more protein; less fat; fewer calories; and an ideal balance of calcium, phosphorus, and vitamin D to encourage slower growth to support joint health and prevent obesity.</p><h3>Our picks for puppy food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><a Puppy Recipe (button)</bi-shortcode></aside>\n\tThe best dry senior dog food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6067777b856cd700198a2fbd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Senior Dog\" height=\"1251\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chewy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Senior diets are intended for the unique needs of older dogs. \"Senior diets are formulated to target some of the common ailments of older pets, such as joint health, digestive health, immune health, and possibly others,\" said Swanson.&#160;</p><p>These diets may contain higher amounts of protein, higher quality protein to maintain muscle, fiber to aid in fecal elimination, additional antioxidants to limit oxidative stress and aid in immune response, and additional omega-3 fatty acids for cognitive performance.</p><p>Since older dogs are often less active, these diets typically contain fewer calories. Some foods are also lower in protein, but contrary to popular belief, healthy senior dogs may actually benefit from more protein than younger adult dogs. If your dog does not have health conditions, look for a senior diet that is lower in fat and calories and contains extra protein &#8212; the AAFCO minimum protein for adult dogs is 18%.</p><h3>Our picks for senior dog food:</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fpurina-pro-plan-bright-mind-adult-7%2Fdp%2F113975\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Purina Pro headline-regular\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fpurina-pro-plan-bright-mind-adult-7%2Fdp%2F113975\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener rel=\"noopener\">FDA</a> continues to investigate a potential link between dogs fed grain-free diets and the development of dilated cardiomyopathy &#8212; talk to your veterinarian before feeding your dog this food.<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"606751802d043700189df300\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Freestyle Grain-Free Senior Trout and Sweet Potato Recipe (26-lb. bag) (button)</bi-shortcode></aside>\n\tOur methodology\n\t\n\t<p>I've been fortunate to interview many veterinarians and veterinary nutritionists throughout my 20-year career writing and editing for pet and veterinary publications, and I've fed my own dog many different dog food brands.&#160;</p><p>For advice on what to look for in a healthy dog food and what to avoid, I consulted two veterinarians and a professor of animal and nutritional science. Although this information guided me in my product selection, our veterinary experts did not specifically endorse any of the products included in this guide. This makes sense since a veterinarian's goal is to find a food that best fits each individual dog, rather than making broad recommendations.&#160;</p><p>All the foods mentioned in this guide are complete and balanced according to the guidelines established by the Association of American Feed Control Officials (AAFCO), contain high-quality ingredients, and offer appropriate levels of protein, fat, and fiber for their respective categories.&#160;</p><p>I also consulted educational materials from the<a href=\"https://talkspetfood.aafco.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> Association of American Feed Control Officials</a> (AAFCO) and the<a href=\"https://wsava.org/global-guidelines/global-nutrition-guidelines/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> Global Nutrition Guidelines</a> published by the World Small Animal Veterinary Association (WSAVA).</p><h3>Here are the main attributes we looked for, in order of importance:</h3><p><strong>AAFCO nutritional adequacy statement:</strong> The most important benchmark of a healthy dog food is a statement on the label that says it meets the nutritional standards established by the AAFCO, demonstrating that the food is complete and balanced for the dog's life stage. All foods mentioned in this guide are AAFCO complete and balanced. Read more about those standards and definitions in the next slide.</p><p><strong>Guaranteed analysis:</strong> The guaranteed analysis lists the percentages of the most vital nutrients in the food: protein, fat, fiber, and moisture. Sometimes, other nutrients like glucosamine, chondroitin, and omega fatty acids are also listed in the guaranteed analysis. Foods selected in this guide contain moderate to high protein (AAFCO minimums are 22% for puppies and 18% for adults) and low to moderate fat (AAFCO minimums are 8.5% for puppies and 5.5% for adults).</p><p><strong>Ingredients list:</strong> The ingredients list can be tricky to navigate, especially when taking water content into account, but in general, you want to see clearly identified animal sources of protein at the top of the list. Whole meat is great, but it is heavier due to its moisture content. Once that water is removed, the meat content might not be as high as you think. Don't automatically write off meat meals. High-quality meat meals can be an excellent source of protein &#8212; the water has been removed, so they may provide more protein than whole meat. The ingredients lists of all the foods in this guide contain animal sources of protein at the top of the list.</p><p><strong>Healthy extras:</strong> According to Swanson, some foods contain extra ingredients intended to support healthy skin, coat, and joints. Some of these may include additional long-chain omega-3 fatty acids (EPA and DHA; usually supplied by marine-based oils or meals), omega-6 fatty acids (safflower oil, sunflower oil, corn oil, flaxseed, etc.), glucosamine, chondroitin, green-lipped mussels, and additional vitamins (vitamin A, biotin) and minerals (zinc, copper). Probiotics, prebiotics, and yeast fermentation products may also boost gut health.</p><p><strong>Calorie content:</strong> The calorie content of dog food is listed in kilocalories, or k/cals. When dogs consume too many calories, they are at risk for becoming overweight or obese. Less-active dogs need fewer calories and very active dogs like performance or working dogs need a food that is more calorie dense. For most dogs, being able to eat the largest volume of food while staying within the ideal daily calorie range will help them feel more satisfied. In general, such foods rated higher in our selection process. Check out this <a href=\"https://www.petnutritionalliance.org/dog.php\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">calorie calculator</a> to determine how many calories your dog needs. Your veterinarian can also evaluate if the amount you're feeding is appropriate.</p><p><strong>Feeding trials:</strong> It's great if a food has undergone feeding trials in addition to a laboratory analysis of the food's ingredients. If the nutritional adequacy statement on the label has language like \"Animal feeding tests using AAFCO procedures substantiate that [product] provides complete and balanced nutrition for [life stage]\" it means the food has been proven via feeding trials to be palatable, digestible, and able sustain pets over time.&#160;&#160;</p><p><strong>Expert formulations:</strong> Choose a pet food manufacturer that works closely with a veterinary nutritionist or other professional with a master's degree or PhD in nutrition, animal science, or a related field. Manufacturers may employ one or more full-time nutritionists, or hire one or more nutrition consultants. For this guide, we prioritized brands that have a dedicated nutrition expert on staff to align with <a href=\"https://wsava.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Savvy-Dog-Owner-s-Guide-to-Nutrition-on-the-Internet.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">WSAVA recommendations</a>.</p><p><strong>Next-level ingredients:</strong> Seeing natural, organic, or human-grade ingredients on the label is nice, especially if you believe in the health benefits of organic foods. Wild-caught fish are as natural as you can get and, unlike farmed fish, are not treated with antibiotics or medications. Some foods use eggs and meat from cage-free chickens and turkeys, which is a bonus if you care about the welfare of the animals you &#8212; and your pets &#8212; eat. That said, ingredients in dog food need not be human-grade, organic, wild-caught, or cage-free to be healthy and nutritious for pets.</p>\n\tAAFCO standards\n\t\n\t<p>The<a href=\"https://talkspetfood.aafco.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> Association of American Feed Control Officials</a> is a private nonprofit corporation that defines ingredients and establishes nutritional profiles for animal feed and pet food. AAFCO establishes model language for states and other governing bodies. It does not regulate, test, approve, or certify pet food. The US Food and Drug Administration, which is a voting member of AAFCO, regulates pet food labels at the federal level. States also regulate pet foods, and most have adopted the model pet food regulations established by AAFCO.</p><p>Dog foods that meet the nutritional standards established by AAFCO may use a statement on the label that says the food is complete and balanced for the dog's life stage according to the<a href=\"https://www.aafco.org/Portals/0/SiteContent/Regulatory/Committees/Pet-Food/Reports/Pet_Food_Report_2013_Midyear-Proposed_Revisions_to_AAFCO_Nutrient_Profiles.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> AAFCO Dog Food Nutrient Profile</a>. There are three life stages: 1) maintenance, for adult dogs more than 1 year old, 2) growth, for puppies less than 1 year old, and which also includes pregnant and lactating females, and 3) all life stages, which is any dog of any age.</p><p>Foods that do not display language asserting that they are complete and balanced as determined by AAFCO standards are labeled for supplemental or intermittent feeding only. Those foods should never be a dog's sole diet as they are not nutritionally adequate.</p><p>Foods can meet AAFCO standards in two ways:</p><ol><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Guaranteed analysis: </strong>Nutrient profiles are determined through laboratory analysis of the food. Foods that meet AAFCO standards as per nutrient profiles will display language like \"formulated to meet the nutritional levels established by the AAFCO Dog Food Nutrient Profiles for [life stage].\" You can always contact the company to confirm the nutrient profile of the food also meets nutritional levels established by the AAFCO.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Feeding trials: </strong>Pet foods can also meet the standards through feeding trials, where the food is fed to animals under controlled conditions and the outcomes are monitored. Feeding trials are not perfect, and they are also very expensive, so not all companies perform them. However, it's nice to see them, though they should not replace nutrient profiles. If you see language like <strong>\"</strong>Animal feeding tests using AAFCO procedures substantiate that [product] provides complete and balanced nutrition for [life stage]\" it means the food has been proven via feeding trials to be palatable, digestible, and able sustain pets over time.</li></ol>\n\tHow to read a pet food label\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606772dfa7d803001963e905?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dog Food_Read Pet Food Label\" height=\"1142\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Dog food packages feature attractive images and targeted descriptions intended to sell you on the quality and healthfulness of the food, but if you really want to know whether a dog food is high quality and a good choice for your dog, learn what to look for on the label.</p><p>A great place to start is <a href=\"https://wsava.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Nutrition-Label-USA-16_9.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this handy reference</a> from the WSAVA about interpreting food labels. The most important information to look for on a label is the AAFCO complete and balanced statement, the guaranteed analysis (crude protein, crude fat, crude fiber, and moisture), and the calorie content statement.</p><p>The ingredients list is also important, but it can be difficult for the average pet owner to know how well their dog will do on a diet just based off the ingredients.</p><p>\"Although many pet owners make their decision based largely on the ingredient panel, it is only one of many considerations,\" Swanson said. \"Without knowing the exact formula and percentage of each ingredient, it is not too useful. What is more important is that the dietary formula is complete and balanced.\"</p><p>Certain terms on pet food labels can be confusing and even misleading. \"Terms like 'natural' and 'organic' are very common in the industry today,\" Swanson said. \"While both terms were intended to highlight higher quality ingredients, they do not guarantee high quality.\" He explained that quality depends on both the raw ingredients and good manufacturing practices. \"Like other ingredients that do not carry these terms, they are highly variable due to differences in soil quality (plants), feed quality (animals), ingredient storage, ingredient handling, etc.,\" he said.</p><p>If you find reading pet food labels confusing, your veterinarian can talk to you about your dog's individual needs, help you choose an appropriate food, and advise how much to feed.</p>\n\tFAQs about dog food\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675245a7d803001963e7db?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FAQs about dog food\" height=\"1124\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Westend61/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>What is the best food I can feed my dog?</h3><p>It's important to find a food your dog likes eating and thrives on, but this may involve a bit of trial and error. Individual dogs digest food differently. Some dogs do better with more protein, some need less. Some dogs can tolerate higher levels of fat; others need less. Dogs also handle amounts of fiber differently. Your veterinarian or a veterinary nutritionist can help you sort out what diet will work best for your dog.</p><p>\"Dogs are individuals,\" said veterinarian Carol Osborne, of the <a href=\"https://www.chagrinfallspetclinic.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chagrin Falls Pet Clinic</a> in Chagrin Falls, Ohio. \"What works well for Dog A, might not work well for Dog B. If you want to know if a food is good for your pet, look at your pet. Your pet is a reflection of what he or she is eating.\"</p><p>Outward signs of good health include clear eyes and nose, ears that aren't smelly, and a coat that isn't dry, flakey, or shedding excessively. Your dog should not be vomiting or experiencing diarrhea. \"Soft stool is not normal,\" Osborne said. \"Bowel movements should be formed and homogenous. You should not be able to make out the pea, the piece of corn, the carrot. [Homogenous stool] means the food has all been digested.\"</p><h3>What is human-grade dog food?</h3><p>Pet foods that use the term \"human-grade\" must follow strict rules. The term may only be used if it applies to the finished food as a whole &#8212; not individual ingredients. Both the ingredients and finished product must be documented to be stored, handled, processed, and transported according to the current good manufacturing practices for human-edible foods, and the label must clearly state that the food is intended for dogs.</p><p>Swanson has tested a few human-grade pet foods in his lab over the years. \"While I don't have a strong preference to any one type or brand of diet, I can say that the human-grade foods I have had experience with are highly palatable, highly digestible, and resulted in a low volume of stool that allowed for easy clean up,\" he said.</p><h3>Is a raw diet good for my dog?</h3><p>A raw diet consists of uncooked meat, bones, and vegetables. Raw pet food poses dangers to both dogs and humans. Veterinarians told <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/raw-food-diet-for-dogs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Insider Reviews </a>that despite some reported benefits, there are too many risks for pets, including bacterial infections, nutritional deficiencies, and injuries from bones in the food. In addition, people who are immunocompromised, elderly people, and young children are at risk of bacterial infections if they live in a household where a dog is fed a raw diet. For more information, read the statements from the <a href=\"https://www.fda.gov/animal-veterinary/animal-health-literacy/get-facts-raw-pet-food-diets-can-be-dangerous-you-and-your-pet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FDA</a> and <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/healthypets/publications/pet-food-safety.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CDC</a> regarding the health and safety risks of feeding raw dog foods.</p>\n\tOur sources\n\t\n\t<ul><li><a href=\"https://nutrsci.illinois.edu/directory/ksswanso\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dr. Kelly S. Swanson MS, PhD</a>, is a professor of animal and nutritional sciences in the College of Agricultural, Consumer and Environmental Sciences at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Urbana, Illinois. Dr. Swanson's lab conducts research on nutrition-related problems like obesity and intestinal health. Dr. Swanson is the Kraft Heinz Company Endowed Professor in Human Nutrition.</li><li>Jean Dodds, DVM, obtained her veterinary degree from Ontario Veterinary College. A clinical research veterinarian for more than 50 years, Dr. Dodds has more than 150 research publications. She is the founder of <a href=\"https://hemopet.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hemopet</a>, the first nonprofit national animal blood bank. Dr. Dodds is the developer of NutriScan, a food sensitivity and intolerance diagnostic test for dogs, cats and horses. She co-authored two books with Diana Laverdure, The Canine Thyroid Epidemic: Answers You Need for Your Dog (Dogwise, 2011) and Canine Nutrigenomics: Foods that Heal Your Dog (Dogwise, 2015).</li><li>Carol Osborne, DVM, is founder and director of the <a href=\"https://www.chagrinfallspetclinic.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chagrin Falls Veterinary Center</a> in Chagrin Falls, Ohio. She is author of the books Naturally Healthy Cats (Marshall, 2006) and Naturally Healthy Dogs (Marshall, 2006) and hosts a weekly National Pet Talk AM radio show broadcast. Dr. Osborne has appeared on Good Day L.A. and Today in New York, where she was the on-camera staff veterinarian.</li><li><a href=\"https://talkspetfood.aafco.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Association of American Feed Control Officials (AAFCO)</a>&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://wsava.org/global-guidelines/global-nutrition-guidelines/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">World Small Animal Veterinary Association (WSAVA) Global Nutrition Guidelines</a>&#160;</li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a height: 21px;\">Yes</td><td style=\"width: 14.2857%; height: 21px;\">4000mAh</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>The best Samsung Galaxy deals happening right now:</h2><h2>Samsung Galaxy S21</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"600075df86385443b40b091e\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy S21 (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"600075df86385443b40b091e\" data-purchase-option=\"B&Hmp;H\">Galaxy S21 (medium, Preferred: B&#38;H)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"600075df86385443b40b091e\" data-purchase-option=\"Verizon\">Galaxy S21 (medium, Preferred: Verizon)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$799.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 888</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.2 inches (1080p, 120Hz)</li><li><strong>Cameras: </strong>10-MP front, 12-MP wide, 12-MP ultra-wide, 64-MP 3X telephoto up to 30x</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-s21-vs-s21-plus-vs-s21-ultra-which-should-you-buy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to which Samsung Galaxy S21 is best for you</a><br></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy S21 is the smallest of Samsung&#39;s new flagship phones, with a 6.2-inch 2400 x 1080 resolution display. It also includes 8 gigabytes (GB) of RAM, a 10-megapixel (MP) front camera, and three rear cameras: a 12-MP wide, 12-MP ultra wide, and a 64-MP telephoto lens. It is available with either 128GB or 256GB of storage and starts at $799.99. </p><p>We <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-s21-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">praised the S21</a> for its attractive, easy-to-hold design, long battery life, and great camera - though we thought the low-light photos could be a bit better. Overall, this is a great phone and a particularly good choice for those who want a new Android phone with the latest capabilities, but do not need a massive screen.</p><h2>Samsung Galaxy S21 Plus</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"600079dedb505f4790405a9d\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy S21 Plus (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"600079dedb505f4790405a9d\" data-purchase-option=\"Samsung\">Galaxy S21 Plus (medium, Preferred: Samsung)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$999.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 888</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.7 inches (1080p, 120Hz)</li><li><strong>Cameras: </strong>10-MP front, 12-MP wide, 12-MP ultra-wide, 64-MP 3x telephoto up to 30x</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-samsung-galaxy-s21-plus-ultra-wireless-charger\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to the 5 best wireless chargers for Samsung Galaxy S21 phones in 2021</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Samsung Galaxy S21 Plus has all of the same features of the Galaxy S21, but comes with a bigger 6.7-inch screen. The S21 Plus also comes with either 128GB or 256GB of storage, though its starting price is usually $999.99, making it $200 more expensive than the Galaxy S21.</p><h2>Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"60007ad446b17716c5300a38\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy S21 Ultra (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"60007ad446b17716c5300a38\" data-purchase-option=\"Samsung\">Galaxy S21 Ultra (medium, Preferred: Samsung)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$1,199.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 888</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.8-inch curved 1440p (3,200 x 1,440) 10-120Hz AMOLED</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 40-MP front camera, 108-MP standard wide with phase detection, 12MP 120-degree ultra-wide, 10-MP 3x optical zoom, and 10-MP 10x optical up to 100x digital zoom</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-s21-best-charger\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to the best charger you can buy for the Galaxy S21</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy S21 Ultra is the largest and most feature-rich S21 model. It has a 6.8-inch 3200 x 1440 resolution curved display with 12GB or 16GB of RAM, support for Samsung&#39;s S Pen stylus, a 40-MP front camera, and four rear cameras. You have the option of getting it with 128GB, 256GB, or 512GB of storage, and it usually starts at $1,199.99. </p><p>Like the S21, we <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-s21-ultra-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">found the Galaxy S21 Ultra</a> to have a great screen, a solid build and design, long battery life, and a great camera. However, we found it to feel slightly heavier than the S21 and expensive - especially since it did little to differentiate itself from the middle-of-the-road S21 Plus. The S21 Ultra might be the best fit for camera enthusiasts who feel they are willing to pay a premium for a four camera setup.</p><h2>Samsung Galaxy Note 20</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f2c0f465fa9a42ad12d7c9c\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy Note 20 (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f2c0f465fa9a42ad12d7c9c\" data-purchase-option=\"Amazon\">Galaxy Note 20 (medium, Preferred: Amazon)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$999.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 Plus</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.7-inch 2,400 x 1,080 AMOLED, 60Hz</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 10-MP front camera, 12-MP main, 12-MP ultra-wide (120-degree field-of-view), 64-MP 3-30x zoom</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-charging-station-usb-hub\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to the best charging stations and hubs in 2021</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy Note 20 and the Note 20 Ultra were released in August of 2020 and are the latest in Samsung&#39;s distinctive note-taking devices. Both the Note 20 and The Note 20 Ultra are 5G ready and feature the S-Pen, Samsung&#39;s digital stylus that seamlessly tucks away into the bottom corner of the bezels.</p><p>Users can take notes in the Samsung Notes app and watch them sync in real time with Microsoft Outlook and OneNote. Notes can also be exported to Microsoft Word and Powerpoint for smooth integration and productivity.</p><p>The base-level Galaxy Note 20  typically retails for $999.99 and is hard to recommend at that price. The 60Hz refresh rate and plastic casing make this a tough sell in the premium market. </p><p>However, this is still a solid phone and could be a good pickup at the right price for someone who loves writing notes by hand.</p><h2>Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f2c0fd128ea7134494a91fc\" data-purchase-option=\"Samsung\">Galaxy Note 20 Ultra (medium, Preferred: Samsung)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f2c0fd128ea7134494a91fc\" data-purchase-option=\"B&Hmp;H\">Galaxy Note 20 Ultra (medium, Preferred: B&#38;H)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f2c0fd128ea7134494a91fc\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy Note 20 Ultra (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f2c0fd128ea7134494a91fc\" data-purchase-option=\"Amazon\">Galaxy Note 20 Ultra (medium, Preferred: Amazon)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$1,299.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 Plus</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.9-inch 3,088 x 1,400 AMOLED. 120Hz at 1080p, 60Hz at 1440p</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 10-MP front camera, 108-MP main, 12-MP ultra-wide (120-degree field-of-view), 12-MP 5-50x zoom with laser auto-focus sensor</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-airpods-pro-vs-samsung-galaxy-buds-pro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">See how Samsung&#39;s Galaxy Buds Pro compare to Apple&#39;s AirPods Pro</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy Note 20 Ultra offers a more well-rounded experience than its smaller sibling. It has a bigger curved display than the Note 20 and  includes a 120Hz refresh rate at 1080p, which drops down to  60Hz  at 1440p. It also has more RAM - 12GB - and comes with the option for 512GB storage.  The Ultra - which normally starts at $1,299.99 - also has three rear cameras, including a 108MP wide lens.  </p><p>We <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-note-20-ultra-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">found the Ultra</a> to be powerful, with a premium design, a great screen and good battery life. We wished the full 1440p was not limited to a 60Hz refresh rate, while the curved edges of the screen made it difficult to write with the S-Pen. We would not recommend getting this phone at full price, but the Note 20 Ultra has a lot to offer note takers if it can be had for under $1,000.</p><h2>The Galaxy S20 FE</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f7c768e2c44cc17611765f7\" data-purchase-option=\"Amazon\">Galaxy S20 FE (medium, Preferred: Amazon)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f7c768e2c44cc17611765f7\" data-purchase-option=\"B&Hmp;H\">Galaxy S20 FE (medium, Preferred: B&#38;H)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$699.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 865</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.5-inch 1080p 120Hz Super AMOLED</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 32-MP front camera, 12-MP standard wide, 12-MP ultra-wide, 8-MP 3x optical zoom and up to 30x digital zoom, OIS</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-cheap-headphones\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to the best cheap headphones</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy S20 FE, or Fan Edition, is a pared-down version of last year&#39;s S20 lineup. It was released in October and offers many premium features - such as 5G, a crisp and large screen with a 120Hz refresh rate, 6GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage - at a non-premium price of $699.99.  </p><p>It still has three rear cameras, though they are not as powerful as some of the more premium Galaxy models. The back of the phone is plastic instead of metal, but it still feels premium and durable. We <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-s20-fe-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">found this phone</a> to be a good choice for most people due to its solid design, great battery life, nice screen and fair price.</p><h2>Galaxy Z Fold 2</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f4fb9c65b83c0288e33a51c\" data-purchase-option=\"Samsung\">Galaxy Z Fold 2 (medium, Preferred: Samsung)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5f4fb9c65b83c0288e33a51c\" data-purchase-option=\"Amazon\">Galaxy Z Fold 2 (medium, Preferred: Amazon)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$1,799.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 Plus</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>7.6 inches with 2,208 x 1,768 resolution (Main screen); 6.2 inches with 2,260 x 816 resolution (Cover screen)</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 10-MP front camera, 10-MP cover camera, 12-MP ultra-wide, 12-MP wide-angle camera, 12-MP telephoto camera</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-tab-s7-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our review of Samsung&#39;s Galaxy Tab S7</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy Z Fold 2 is Samsung&#39;s most expensive and ambitious phone to date. Its distinguishing feature is its large, folding display. The main screen is 7.6 inches with 2,208 x 1,768 resolution, while the cover screen is 6.2 inches with 2,260 x 816 resolution. </p><p>Samsung recently lowered the price on the Galaxy Z Fold 2 by $200 -from $1999.99 to $1799.99 - but it&#39;s still  pricey. Unlike its poorly reviewed predecessor, we found the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-z-fold-2-review#the-bottom-line\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Galaxy Z Fold 2</a> to be the most promising foldable device on the market. </p><p>We liked its vibrant, tablet-sized screen, its long battery life, and excellent speakers, but found its design to be a little awkward in phone-mode. It also lacked any waterproof rating, which we found disappointing for a phone this expensive. Ultimately, this is a device that is really only for those who are willing to pay a premium to try out the latest in foldable screen technology, but these discounts make it a little more palatable.</p><h2>Galaxy Z Flip 5G</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"605cdb8e065f57001851984c\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galazy Z Flip 5G (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$1,199.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 Plus</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.7 inches, 1080 x 2636 pixels AMOLED main display and 1.1 inches, 112 x 300 pixels cover display</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 10-MP front camera, 12-MP wide, 12-MP ultra-wide</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-phones\">Check out our guide to the best phones</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy Z Flip 5G is Samsung&#39;s attempt at modernizing the classic flip phone. The Flip features a 6.9-inch foldable glass display-  unlike the plastic display found on the Motorola Razr - as well as three 12MP rear cameras, and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 Plus processor. The Flip 5G launched in August at $1,450, but is now only available in a 256GB model that is regularly priced at $1,199.99. </p><p>We found the non-5G version of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-new-galaxy-z-flip-phone-best-features-price-2020-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the Galaxy Z Flip</a> to bring something new to the smartphone experience, while also functioning well enough as a standard smartphone. However, we thought the Flip&#39;s cover screen was a little too thin and awkward when it was closed, and wished it was waterproof. The price of Flip makes it, like the Galaxy Fold 2, a niche item for those wanting a new - but not yet perfected - flexible smartphone.</p><h2><strong>Galaxy A71 5G</strong></h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"605e03c5065f5700185198c7\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy A71 5G (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$599.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Qualcomm Snapdragon 765</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.7-inch OLED (2400x1080), 60Hz</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 32-MP,  64-MP main, 12-MP ultrawide, 5-MP macro, 5-MP depth</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wireless-earbuds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to the best true wireless earbuds in 2021</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy A71 5G was released in June of 2020 as a lower-priced option for those looking to get a 5G phone without all of the more expensive features. It comes with a 6.7-inch 1080p OLED screen, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage. It has four rear cameras with a 64MP main lens, a 32MP front camera, and is priced at $599. It has good battery life, but lacks the ability to charge wirelessly. Ultimately, this is a good choice for those looking for a solid, yet basic, 5G phone.</p><h2>Galaxy A 51 5G</h2><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"605cdc9a0067080018af0504\" data-purchase-option=\"Best Buy\">Galaxy A51 5G (medium, Preferred: Best Buy)</bi-shortcode><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Typical price: </strong>$499.99</li><li><strong>Processor: </strong>Exynos 9611</li><li><strong>Screen (resolution, refresh rate): </strong>6.5-inch 1080p (2,400 x 1,080) 60Hz AMOLED</li><li><strong>Cameras:</strong> 32-MP front,  48-MP main, 12-MP ultrawide, 5-MP macro, 5-MP depth</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-phone-charger\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our guide to the best phone chargers in 2021</a></strong></li></ul></aside><p>The Galaxy A 51 5G was released in April of 2020 and is smaller and slightly older than the Galaxy A 71. It is priced at $499.99 and has a 6.5-inch 1080p AMOLED display, 4GB of RAM, 128GB of storage, and a 48MP four-lens rear camera, along with a 32MP front camera. </p><p>We <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-a51-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">found it</a> to have a great screen, decent battery life, and nice cameras, but wondered if the phone compromised a little too much on overall performance. This is a great entry level 5G phone, but one that might feel slow and dated sooner rather than later.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"MLB pulls 2021 All-Star Game from Georgia in the wake of the new voting law","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/mlb-pulls-2021-all-star-game-from-georgia-voting-law-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677219a7d803001963e900?format=jpeg\" alt=\"truist park\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>MLB decided on Friday to pull its All-Star Game from Truist Park in Atlanta.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Adam Hagy/MLB Photos/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Major League Baseball announced on Friday that it would no longer host its All-Star Game in Atlanta.</li>\n<li>The move came in the wake of a restrictive voting law enacted in Georgia last week.</li>\n<li>President Joe Biden had said he would support MLB moving the game over the law.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Major League Baseball <a href=\"https://www.mlb.com/press-release/press-release-mlb-statement-regarding-2021-all-star-game\">announced</a> on Friday that it would no longer host its 2021 All-Star Game in Atlanta in the wake of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-lawmakers-pass-sweeping-election-administration-bill-2021-3\">Georgia&#39;s new restrictive voting law</a>.</p><p>&#34;Over the last week, we have engaged in thoughtful conversations with Clubs, former and current players, the Players Association, and The Players Alliance, among others, to listen to their views,&#34; Commissioner Rob Manfred said in a statement. &#34;I have decided that the best way to demonstrate our values as a sport is by relocating this year&#39;s All-Star Game and MLB Draft.</p><p>&#34;Major League Baseball fundamentally supports voting rights for all Americans and opposes restrictions to the ballot box ... Fair access to voting continues to have our game&#39;s unwavering support.&#34;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Lindsey Adler  (@lindseyadler) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1378058309278838787?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 2, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The Atlanta Braves said in a statement that they were &#34;saddened&#34; by the decision and that it would hurt businesses, employees, and fans.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Atlanta Braves  (@Braves) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1378072546088738818?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 2, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>President Joe Biden had said on Wednesday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-move-mlb-all-star-game-georgia-new-voting-law-2021-4\">that he would support</a> the league moving the All-Star Game.</p><p>&#34;I think today&#39;s professional athletes are acting incredibly responsibly,&#34; Biden told ESPN&#39;s Sage Steele. &#34;I would strongly support them doing that. People look to them. They&#39;re leaders.&#34;</p><p>Biden had described the law, enacted last week, as &#34;Jim Crow on steroids.&#34; Gov. Brian Kemp <a href=\"https://twitter.com/GovKemp/status/1375553409173090304\">pushed back</a> on the characterization.</p><p>This year&#39;s All-Star Game is intended to honor the MLB legend <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/hank-aaron-dead-home-run-king-2021-1\">Hank Aaron</a>, who died in January. No new location was announced on Friday.</p><p><em>This story is breaking. Check back for updates.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/mlb-pulls-2021-all-star-game-from-georgia-voting-law-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/cKUf5xo00KQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 19:14:38 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60677256a7d803001963e901?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"7f9063da38c40704a38cd34fda3faeca","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn12@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-41-562_e0df897dd890a69b.webp","destWidth":1519,"destHeight":1139,"sourceBytes":223290,"destBytes":223290,"author":"aharoun@businessinsider.com (Azmi Haroun,Scott Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60677219a7d803001963e900?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn88@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-53-181_6347bc76386e4d03.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-42-123_7a01f1d237a1503b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn40@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-58-885_2eb4ded2fd9ed915.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cKUf5xo00KQ:UQvDNihBun0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn16@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-42-774_02bdabd9e9870a49.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/cKUf5xo00KQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn100@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-57-485_c23be7897aea3be5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373920},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Earth contains buried chunks of an alien world that are 'millions of times larger than Mount Everest,' research suggests","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pieces-planet-theia-buried-in-earth-mantle-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6062419ac9d73b00186e90c1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"theia\" height=\"2400\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An artist&#39;s depiction of an impact of a protoplanet like Theia and Earth.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theia_%28planet%29#/media/File:Artist%27s_concept_of_collision_at_HD_172555.jpg\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/Wikimedia Commons</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Two gigantic blobs of dense rock hundreds of miles tall sit deep inside Earth.</li>\n<li>New research suggests these blobs are remnants of a planet that hit Earth 4.5 billion years ago.</li>\n<li>The collision of Earth and this ancient planet, called Theia, may have helped create the moon.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>If you were to peer deep under Earth&#39;s crust, you&#39;d spot two giant blobs of rock cupping the planet&#39;s core like a pair of hands.</p><p>The source of these mysterious continent-sized formations - one under the Pacific Ocean, the other under Africa -has baffled geologists for four decades. <a href=\"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41561-018-0225-2\">Some experts have suggested</a> that the massive rocks are fragments of tectonic plates that got trapped under their counterparts.</p><p>But according to <a href=\"https://www.hou.usra.edu/meetings/lpsc2021/pdf/1980.pdf\">new research</a>, their origin may be otherworldly.</p><p>A group of scientists from Arizona State University suggested the blobs are remnants of a &#34;Mars-sized planetary embryo&#34; named Theia, which struck Earth in its infancy 4.5 billion years ago. The impact is thought to have turned Earth&#39;s surface into a sea of fiery magma and caused it to shoot out enough planetary debris to create the moon. </p><p>Qian Yuan, the lead researcher behind the findings, studies geodynamics at ASU. He thinks that following the ancient collision, parts of Theia may have sunk and gotten preserved deep in our planet&#39;s mantle - the semisolid layer between Earth&#39;s crust and core, he said.</p><p>Those pieces are &#34;millions of times larger than Mount Everest in terms of volume,&#34; Yuan told Insider. </p><h2>Dense areas up to 621 miles in height</h2><p>Geologists discovered these chunks - their technical name is large low-shear-velocity provinces - by sending seismic waves down into the planet. Under both Africa and the Pacific Ocean, the speed of these seismic waves slowed to a crawl, suggesting an area of rock denser than its surroundings. The animation below, based on a <a href=\"https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:LLSVP.gif\">2016 analysis</a>, shows the size of these areas.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><a title=\"Sanne.cottaar, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commonsommons\" href=\"https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:LLSVP.gif\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/29/LLSVP.gif?format=jpeg\" alt=\"LLSVP\" height=\"\" width=\"512\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></div><p>According to Yuan, these blobs are between 1.5 and 3.5% more dense than the rest of Earth&#39;s mantle, and hotter.</p><p>If the planet Theia was rich in iron and highly dense, Yuan&#39;s models showed, any pieces of it that broke off when it hit Earth would have sunk deep into our planet&#39;s mantle. There, they could have accumulated undisturbed, rather than getting mixed into the rest of the mantle.</p><p>It&#39;s also possible denser <a href=\"https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/93JB03403\">chunks of Earth&#39;s crust</a> sank into the mantle and joined them, contributing to the blobs&#39; growth over time, Yuan said. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/57b752c4db5ce91c008b7dc2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"earth core crust mantle layers shutterstock\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An illustration of Earth&#39;s layers. The mantle is in bright red.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Figuring out what these slabs are made of is challenging. Their deepest parts are 1,800 miles under our feet, in the part of the mantle closest to Earth&#39;s outer core. They&#39;re 621 miles (1,000 kilometers) high and two to three times wider than they are tall. </p><p>But scientists have figured out that plumes of hot rock and magma from some Icelandic and Samoan volcanoes <a href=\"https://www.nature.com/articles/nature11141\">came from these blobs</a>. By analyzing this magma&#39;s makeup, researchers can glean insight into the composition of these mysterious buried chunks. According to a <a href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0009281919300509\">2019 study</a>, some elements in the volcanic plumes date back to about 4.5 billion years ago - when Theia supposedly hit Earth.</p><h2>When planets collide</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f93902bf21803001222bc35?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the moon surface\" height=\"900\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The moon, as viewed by NASA&#39;s Mariner 10 in 1973.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/feature/jpl/the-moon-is-rusting-and-researchers-want-to-know-why\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL/Northwestern University</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The idea that the impact between a tiny planet and Earth helped form the moon has been around for <a href=\"https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/2017JE005333#jgre20813-bib-0007\">more than 45 years</a>. But a problem with that hypothesis is that scientists haven&#39;t found any evidence of Theia&#39;s existence.</p><p><a href=\"https://science.sciencemag.org/content/351/6272/493\">A 2016 study</a> suggested that&#39;s because Earth&#39;s and Theia&#39;s cores fused together. Another idea, <a href=\"https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/2017JE005333\">put forward in 2018,</a> posits that when the planets collided, both were &#34;almost completely vaporized,&#34; Yuan said. According to that thinking, Earth became a rapidly spinning mass of molten and vaporized rock called a synestia, then <a href=\"https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2018/02/180228103238.htm\">collapsed back into a molten planet</a>. Part of that spinning mass became the moon, and Theia was no more.</p><p>A third theory - called the &#34;hit-and-run,&#34; according to Yuan - is that Theia just glanced off Earth, and chunks of one planet, or pieces from both, combined to form the moon. But the moon&#39;s composition matches Earth&#39;s almost exactly, which suggests it contains very little of Theia.</p><p>Yuan&#39;s new findings, which will soon be published in the journal Geophysical Research Letters, may finally offer proof that Theia was in our solar system billions of years ago.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pieces-planet-theia-buried-in-earth-mantle-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=mbOowFFEP3U:uYi-FWOSi1g:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=mbOowFFEP3U:uYi-FWOSi1g:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mbOowFFEP3U:uYi-FWOSi1g:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=mbOowFFEP3U:uYi-FWOSi1g:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mbOowFFEP3U\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 18:32:01 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/606241ac67187800184ad2db?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"83a1a55d2961c89f9b2b52821ea40026","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn63@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-40-265_7d9feff52df9b0de.webp","destWidth":3000,"destHeight":2249,"sourceBytes":137978,"destBytes":137978,"author":"awoodward@insider.com
