charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p> </p><p>Earlier Friday, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-capitol-is-on-lockdown-over-an-external-security-threat-2021-4\">Capitol went on lockdown</a> after a vehicle rammed into an outside barricade and injured two officers. Evans later died from his injuries sustained during the incident, and the other officer remains hospitalized but in stable condition.</p><p>The suspect was shot dead by one of the officers after the driver exited the car brandishing a weapon.</p><p>The USCP identified the fallen officer as Evans in a statement following the attack outside the Capitol.</p><p>&#34;It is with profound sadness that I share the news of the passing of Officer William &#39;Billy&#39; Evans this afternoon from injuries he sustained following an attack at the North Barricade by a lone assailant,&#34; Yogananda Pittman, acting USCP Chief Officer, said in a <a href=\"https://www.uscp.gov/media-center/press-releases/loss-uscp-colleague-officer-william-f-evans\">statement</a>.</p><p>&#34;Evans had been a member of the United States Capitol Police for 18 years,&#34; Pittman continued in the statement. &#34;He began his USCP service on March 7, 2003, and was a member of the Capitol Division&#39;s First Responder&#39;s Unit. Please keep Officer Evans and his family in your thoughts and prayers.&#34;</p><p>Flags at the Capitol and the White House were ordered to be flown at half-staff by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-ordered-flags-flown-half-staff-capitol-police-officer-died-2021-4\">House Speaker Nancy Pelosi</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-white-house-flags-half-staff-capitol-police-officer-death-2021-4\">President Joe Biden</a> respectively to honor the fallen police officer.</p><p>Less than three months ago, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-siege-module\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"d1aec89d6c29df3f663e5b1ed8e82ca9\">pro-Trump rioters stormed the Capitol</a>, resulting in the deaths of five people - including two Capitol Police officers.</p><p>&#34;We send our heartfelt condolences to Officer Evans&#39; family, and everyone grieving his loss,&#34; Biden said in a statement following the incident. &#34;We know what a difficult time this has been for the Capitol, everyone who works there, and those who protect it.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a here</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Cornell is <a href=\"https://www.usnews.com/education/best-global-universities/rankings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">one of the most prestigious schools in the world</a>. To set foot on campus as a student, you need to be in the 11% of applicants who had the test scores, extracurriculars, and je-ne-sais-quoi-factor to be accepted. </p><p>But, thanks to partnerships with e-learning companies like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/edx-overview-faq\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">edX</a>, you can also take a handful of <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&awinaffid=257137&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fschool%2Fcornellxcornellx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Cornell courses for free</a> - without relocating, adhering to strict class times, or spending a dime. You can also do the same with other Ivy League institutions and top schools including <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/harvard-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Harvard</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/princeton-university-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Princeton</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/yale-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Yale</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-columbia-university-online-courses-edx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Columbia</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/university-of-pennsylvania-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UPenn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-massachusetts-institute-of-technology-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MIT</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-online-johns-hopkins-university-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Johns Hopkins</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-online-university-of-michigan-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the University of Michigan</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/duke-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Duke</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stanford-university-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stanford</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nyu-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NYU</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-online-courses-from-best-colleges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">more</a>.</p><p>Below, you can find 14 of the best free Cornell courses available online. Some have the option to pay a small fee for certificates of completion that you can show potential employers or add to your LinkedIn or resume.</p><h3>14 free Cornell courses you can take through edX:</h3>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tA Hands-on Introduction to Engineering Simulations\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065cdc5daf0f10018f996c7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell online courses person on laptop on table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Leon Neal/Staff/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065d8943d35010018fe0ee4\" data-purchase-option=\"\">A Hands-on Introduction to Engineering Simulations (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>This hands-on intermediate engineering course teaches you how to analyze common problems involving different physics &#8212; structural mechanics, fluid dynamics, and heat transfer &#8212; using ANSYS simulation software.</p>\n\tTeaching and Learning in the Diverse Classroom\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677c42a7d803001963e959?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell classes\" height=\"2624\" width=\"3982\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">kali9/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065d9453d35010018fe0ee7\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Teaching &#38; Learning in the Diverse Classroom (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>5 weeks</p><p>Learn how to create inclusive, student-centered learning environments with tools such as inclusive course design and student-centered pedagogical practices. Students listen and reflect on lived experiences &#8212; including their own &#8212; as well as explore key research on learning and diversity and its importance in education.&#160;</p>\n\tSharks!\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677ba3a7d803001963e94f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cornell classes\" height=\"3317\" width=\"4980\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Julian Gunther/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065db7f3d35010018fe0eea\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Sharks! (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>Learn about what makes sharks fascinating through activities &#8212; tracking the movements of a wild shark, observing shark habitats and behavior, diving into the fossil record &#8212; as well as their functional anatomy, biology, ecological role, impact on human behavior, and conservation efforts among other things.</p>\n\tRelativity and Astrophysics\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677ccea7d803001963e95d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell classes\" height=\"4144\" width=\"6090\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">MARK GARLICK/SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065dd7a065f570018519b8e\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Relativity and Astrophysics (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>This course combines relativity and astronomy to give students insight and quantitative skills to better understand the universe &#8212; from analyzing paradoxes in special relativity to pinpointing daily instances in which relativity is important.</p><p><em>This class is archived, which means you'll have access to course materials but you won't be able to upgrade for graded homework or earn a certificate of completion.&#160; </em></p>\n\tStructuring Business Agreements for Success\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065e75e902281001950a92f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX free Cornell courses man holding laptop outside\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Buro Millennial/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065e688065f570018519b91\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Structuring Business Agreements for Success (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>5 weeks</p><p>Learn the laws, principles, and guidelines needed to structure business agreements and assess the merits and challenges of different choices.&#160;&#160;</p><p><em>This class is archived.&#160;</em></p>\n\tThe Ethics of Eating\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677db5856cd700198a2fec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell classes\" height=\"2649\" width=\"3974\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alexander Spatari/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065e8363d35010018fe0efa\" data-purchase-option=\"\">The Ethics of Eating (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length:</strong> 4 weeks</p><p>This course leads students into an exploration of the ethical issues at play every time we consume or purchase food. Using insights from a diverse group of philosophers, food scientists, activists, industry specialists, and farmers, you'll consider the morality of food: how it's produced, distributed, marketed, and consumed.</p><p><em>This class is archived. </em></p>\n\tAn Introduction to Evidence-Based Undergraduate STEM Teaching\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065f01e902281001950a97b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX free Cornell courses women with laptop on balcony\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Oscar Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065ef33065f570018519b94\" data-purchase-option=\"\">An Introduction to Evidence-Based Undergraduate STEM Teaching (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>8 weeks</p><p>Future STEM faculty, graduate students, and post-doctoral fellows learn about effective teaching strategies and supporting science, specifically for STEM classrooms, in this course. Students consider expertise from experienced STEM faculty, educational researchers, and university staff as they tackle course design, teaching strategies, and key learning principles.&#160;</p><p><em>This class is archived.&#160;</em></p>\n\tAdvancing Learning Through Evidence-Based STEM Teaching\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065f194902281001950a984?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX free Cornell courses man on couch with laptop\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ekaterina Bolovtsova/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065f11e065f570018519b9c\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Advancing Learning Through Evidence-Based STEM Teaching (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>8 weeks</p><p>This course prepares current and future STEM teachers in effective teaching strategies and accompanying research to create active, impactful classrooms &#8212; including the import of diversity and how to incorporate it into a classroom. This course builds upon the introductory course above.</p><p><em>This class is archived. </em></p>\n\tAmerican Capitalism: A History\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677e62856cd700198a2ff5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell classes\" height=\"2658\" width=\"3987\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maremagnum/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065ea692d043700189df236\" data-purchase-option=\"\">American Capitalism: A History (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>Take a close look at how economic development fueled the US' rise to power In the end, you should be able to recognize and criticize public policies that interact with American capitalism and have a solid understanding of it as an ever-changing system, even if basic features remain unchanged.&#160;</p><p><em>This class is archived.</em></p>\n\tNetworks, Crowds, and Markets\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065ec7b902281001950a963?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX free Cornell courses man with laptop and headphones\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alistair Berg/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065eb6c2d043700189df239\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Networks, Crowds and Markets (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>10 weeks</p><p>To understand the interconnectedness of modern life, students get into game theory, the structure of the Internet, social contagion, the spread of social power, and information cascades.</p><p><em>This class is archived.&#160;</em></p>\n\tThe Science and Politics of the GMO\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60677fb4a7d803001963e96f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell classes\" height=\"3603\" width=\"5405\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kseniya Ovchinnikova/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065f2423d35010018fe0f05\" data-purchase-option=\"\">The Science and Politics of the GMO (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>5 weeks</p><p>Learn the basics of genetic engineering and biotechnology in this introductory Food and Nutrition course. Students delve into the political debate surrounding GMOs, evaluate how social science concepts affect biotech development and usage, and learn to form good research questions and assess research reports, among other things.</p><p><em>This class is archived.&#160;</em></p>\n\tThe Computing Technology Inside Your Smartphone\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60678075a7d803001963e971?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cornell classes\" height=\"4000\" width=\"6000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Towfiqu Barbhuiya / EyeEm/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065f4f53d35010018fe0f08\" data-purchase-option=\"\">The Computing Technology Inside Your Smartphone (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>10 weeks</p><p>Explore the powerful computer processor that enables smartphones to be so indispensable. Students start with the fundamentals of computing technology and then move into advanced performance techniques and details of processors.&#160;</p><p><em>This class is archived.</em></p>\n\tReclaiming Broken Places: Introduction to Civic Ecology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065f3a9902281001950a992?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX free Cornell courses woman with laptop by window\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ekaterina Bolovtsova/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065f84c3d35010018fe0f0b\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Reclaiming Broken Places: Introduction to Civic Ecology (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>In this course, you use many lenses &#8212; psychological, sociological, political, educational, and ecological &#8212; to examine how people care for nature and their communities. Among other things, students learn how civic ecology can enable communities with limited resources to cope with disaster and struggle.&#160;</p><p><em>This class is archived.&#160;</em></p>\n\tWiretaps to Big Data: Privacy and Surveillance in the Age of Interconnection\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065f6fd902281001950a9a5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX free Cornell courses woman sitting on couch with laptop\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christina Morillo/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"6065f7c2065f570018519ba2\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Wiretaps to Big Data: Privacy and Surveillance in the Age of Interconnection (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>How does cellular technology enable massive surveillance? Do users have rights against surveillance? This social sciences course grapples with these big questions surrounding privacy issues in modern life and introduces students to related issues in WiFi and Internet surveillance.&#160;</p><p><em>This class is archived.&#160;</em></p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has ordered flags to be flown at half-staff at the US Capitol on Friday. A US Capitol Police officer died after an incident where a man rammed two officers with a car at a security barrier.</p><p>At a press conference on Friday, acting Capitol Police Chief Yogananda Pittman said that a Capitol Police officer <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-capitol-is-on-lockdown-over-an-external-security-threat-2021-4\">died</a> and another was injured after someone rammed a car into a barricade outside the US Capitol building on Friday.</p><p>According to Pittman, the suspect &#34;exited the car with a knife in hand&#34; and lunged at the officers. Pittman said that the suspect did not comply with a verbal command, and the officers opened fire, killing the suspect, she added.</p><p>The Capitol went into lockdown earlier Friday after Capitol Police texted an alert telling people in the complex to stay indoors because of an &#34;external security threat.&#34; Congress is in recess and neither the House nor the Senate are in session.</p><p>At the press conference, hours after the attack, Pittman said the security threat was &#34;neutralized.&#34;</p><p><em>This story is breaking. Haroun)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60677c4e856cd700198a2fe0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn9@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-54-329_3da001a7989bc5b5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=b9kclw35je8:U9sBWk-JKsY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn32@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-50-04-231_9826f0a88de4523d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=b9kclw35je8:U9sBWk-JKsY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn83@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-54-986_0f089765409baac1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=b9kclw35je8:U9sBWk-JKsY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn79@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-48-434_9e03708c5aafa8d5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/b9kclw35je8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn38@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-53-478_9485291a9be9f367.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373793},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Eleven Madison Park launches a food truck to serve underprivileged New Yorkers","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/eleven-madison-park-food-truck-feeding-underprivileged-new-yorkers-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60674708856cd700198a2e50?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 162809853\" height=\"2000\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Neilson Barnard / Staff</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Eleven Madison Truck will feed communities in food-insecure districts in the Bronx and Brooklyn.</li>\n<li>In collaboration with Rethink Food, Eleven Madison Park will offer 2,000 free meals per week.</li>\n<li>The truck will offer meals that the restaurant provided to first responders during the pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/eleven-madison-park-starts-food-truck-ahead-of-nyc-reopening?srnd=premium&sref=BWbpWjRmWjRm\">Bloomberg reported.</a></li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Staff of New York&#39;s famed Eleven Madison Park restaurant will operate a food truck to feed underserved communities starting April 12.</p><p>The thrice Michelin-starred dining restaurant will provide 2,000 free meals per week, it said Friday, as an ongoing collaboration with the nonprofit Rethink Food to feed food-insecure districts in Brooklyn and the Bronx.</p><p>Rethink Food is a New York-based non-profit that was co-founded by Eleven Madison Park&#39;s co-owner and Michelin-starred chef Daniel Humm.</p><p>&#34;The Eleven Madison Truck offers a mobile extension of the restaurant&#39;s commissary kitchen, distributing meals made with the same produce and ingredients utilized at the restaurant on-site in an effort to reduce food insecurity in the communities that need it most,&#34; the restaurant said.</p><p>The truck will offer meals that the restaurant has been providing to first responders and soup kitchens during the pandemic. These meals include jerk chicken with roasted vegetables and grain bowls, <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/eleven-madison-park-starts-food-truck-ahead-of-nyc-reopening?srnd=premium&sref=BWbpWjRmWjRm\">Bloomberg first reported</a> on Friday.</p><p>&#34;We had been brainstorming different ways to make the restaurant part of the community and get staff engaged beyond making meals and pushing them out of the door, and then Daniel called me and was, like, &#39;Let&#39;s do a food truck,&#34; co-founder and chief executive officer of Rethink Matt Jozwiak <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/eleven-madison-park-starts-food-truck-ahead-of-nyc-reopening?srnd=premium&sref=BWbpWjRmWjRm\">told Bloomberg.</a></p><p>Eleven Madison Park will prepare the meals from its leftover ingredients and donated products. The restaurant will also prioritize working with suppliers who support the program, according to Bloomberg. </p><p>&#34;We&#39;re going to ask them to give us some product for free for Rethink, we&#39;ll select our suppliers based on that,&#34; Humm told Bloomberg.</p><p>Operating the truck will cost around $16,000 per month without the food, according to Bloomberg.</p><p>These costs will be partially covered by the Eleven Madison Park diners. For every <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eleven-madison-park-to-go-meal-mean-kit-roast-chicken-2020-10\">$275 home-dinner meal kit</a> bought from the fine-dining restaurant, the Eleven Madison Truck will offer 10 free meals, according to the statement.</p><p>More donations will go to the truck once the restaurant reopens for indoor dining later in 2021, Eleven Madison Park added.</p><p>The restaurant closed its doors in March 2020 when the pandemic hit the country and COVID-19 cases surged. In response to the pandemic, <a href=\"https://stories.zagat.com/posts/matt-jozwiak-and-daniel-humm-take-the-fight-against-hunger-nationwide\">Jozwiak agreed with Humm </a>to use Eleven Madison Park&#39;s kitchen as a commissary kitchen with the goal to prepare 250,000 meals throughout COVID-19. </p><p>Jozwiak, who is also a former cook at the restaurant, previously said in a <a href=\"https://stories.zagat.com/posts/matt-jozwiak-and-daniel-humm-take-the-fight-against-hunger-nationwide\">blog post </a>that Rethink prepares food for 12 community centers in New York.</p><p>Rethink Food alongside Humm and his staff served up to 3,000 meals a day for frontline workers and underserved communities in New York, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nyc-restaurant-eleven-madison-park-may-not-reopen-after-pandemic-2020-5#:~:text=One%20of%20the%20world's%20best%20restaurants%20may%20not%20reopen%20after%20the%20pandemic&text=Daniel%20Humm%2C%20the%20Michelin%2Dstarred,reopen%20once%20coronavirus%20shutdowns%20end.s%20end.\">Insider previously reported</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/eleven-madison-park-food-truck-feeding-underprivileged-new-yorkers-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Fox News is silent on bombshell reports of Matt Gaetz's alleged sexual misconduct and possible sex trafficking of a minor","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-hasnt-mentioned-matt-gaetz-in-almost-2-days-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60673814a7d803001963e755?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tucker carlson matt gaetz\" height=\"1362\" width=\"2726\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Matt Gaetz appears on &#34;Tucker Carlson Tonight&#34; to address a DOJ investigation into him.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fox News</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Fox News is ignoring reports that GOP Rep. Matt Gaetz is under FBI investigation for sex trafficking. </li>\n<li>Since Wednesday evening, media watchdogs report, the network hasn&#39;t mentioned Gaetz&#39;s name a single time. </li>\n<li>Gaetz is a frequent Fox guest and top Trump defender.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Fox News is ignoring perhaps the most shocking story in US politics this week.</p><p>On Tuesday night, The New York Times <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/30/us/politics/matt-gaetz-sex-trafficking-investigation.html\">broke the news</a> that Rep. Matt Gaetz, a Florida Republican and frequent Fox News guest, is under FBI investigation over whether he had sex with a 17-year-old girl and violated federal sex trafficking laws. Gaetz has not been charged in connection to the investigation.</p><p>Soon after the story broke, Gaetz <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/watch-tucker-carlson-matt-gaetz-interview-doj-sex-trafficking-video-2021-3\">appeared on Fox host Tucker Carlson&#39;s show</a> to defend himself against what he called &#34;false sex allegations,&#34; which he claimed were part of a larger extortion plot targeting his family. Afterwards, Carlson told his audience the conversation was &#34;one of the weirdest interviews I&#39;ve ever conducted.&#34;</p><p>Since then, news outlets have reported a series of additional bombshell allegations about Gaetz&#39;s misconduct. On Thursday, <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/01/politics/matt-gaetz-photos-women/index.html\">CNN reported</a> that Gaetz had shown nude photos and videos of women he claimed he&#39;d had sex with to fellow lawmakers. </p><p>On Thursday night, The Times published another <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/01/us/politics/matt-gaetz-justice-department.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=HomepageHomepage\">bombshell report</a> in which it detailed how Gaetz and his associate, a Florida politician who&#39;s been indicted on federal sex trafficking and other charges, allegedly recruited and paid women for sex and used drugs. On Friday, a longtime aide Gaetz aide, communications director Luke Ball, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.in/politics/world/news/matt-gaetzs-spokesperson-resigns-as-the-lawmaker-faces-a-sex-trafficking-scandal/articleshow/81875862.cms\">resigned</a>. </p><p>Since Wednesday evening, media watchdogs <a href=\"https://twitter.com/atrupar/status/1377960411799126019\">report</a>, the network <a href=\"https://pressrun.media/p/fox-news-just-went-30-hours-without\">hasn&#39;t mentioned</a> Gaetz&#39;s name a single time as of midday on Friday. </p><p>A spokesperson for Fox declined to comment on the record. </p><p>Since the scandal broke, Fox has publicly distanced itself from Gaetz. A network spokesperson denied the congressman&#39;s recent claim that he&#39;d discussed a potential job with Fox after leaving office.</p><p>&#34;No one with any level of authority has had conversations with Matt Gaetz for any of our platforms and we have no interest in hiring him,&#34; the spokesperson <a href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/matt-gaetz-says-hes-talked-with-newsmax-oan-and-fox-about-potential-post-congress-gigs\">told</a> multiple media outlets.  </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read Relman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60673814a7d803001963e755?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn72@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-48-549_39f4e3da3909140e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J7b0cB457u0:-e_CxEQUHgY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn11@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-57-807_051fa0f0dbc942d5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J7b0cB457u0:-e_CxEQUHgY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn15@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-50-053_28523bff1f905d5a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J7b0cB457u0:-e_CxEQUHgY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn66@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-58-085_9aca1293cbe3b214.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/J7b0cB457u0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn96@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-46-409_eebe5ea8bf075f4f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373955},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Why some Coca-Cola bottles have a yellow cap","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/kosher-passover-coca-cola-bottles-yellow-cap-bottle-soda-retail-food-drink-jewish-jews-2017-4","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/zn9z9Xqd-jZbcmOYf.html\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"Why some Coca-Cola bottles have a yellow cap\" style=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>In the 1930s, Coca-Cola began producing its signature soft drink with a different sugar substitute, sucrose, that made it kosher for Passover.</li>\n<li>Today, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/why-do-coke-bottles-have-yellow-caps-2017-4\">bottles of Coca-Cola that are kosher for Passover have yellow caps</a> instead of the traditional red ones.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In the 1930s, Coca-Cola began producing their signature soft drink with a different sugar substitute, sucrose, that made it kosher for Passover. Jews observing Passover cut out chametz, or any grain-based products that are capable of leavening. Some Jews also cut out kitniyot, which includes foods like rice, beans, peanuts, and corn. Regular bottles of Coke contain high-fructose corn syrup which is not kosher for Passover. Today, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/why-do-coke-bottles-have-yellow-caps-2017-4\">bottles of Coca-Cola that are kosher for Passover have yellow caps</a> instead of the traditional red ones. In addition to the yellow cap, the bottle has a Passover certification symbol.</p><p>The Hechsher, or the Ⓤ marking on many common food items, is a signifier that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kosher-symbol-appears-nearly-half-food-jewish-shopping-grocery-store-2017-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the food is certified kosher</a>. Kosher for Passover items require an additional Passover hechsher. There are various symbols that appear on food packaging. The symbols differ depending on which kosher organization has certified the food and the contents of the food. The small letters next to kosher symbols signify if the food is dairy, meat, pareve (neither dairy nor meat), or kosher for Passover. You can find the Ⓤ on Oreos, Coca-Cola, and many other items people purchase regularly.</p><p><em>EDITOR&#39;S NOTE: This video was originally published in April 2017.</em></p><p> </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/kosher-passover-coca-cola-bottles-yellow-cap-bottle-soda-retail-food-drink-jewish-jews-2017-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=CH8wzGOjhTA:5oY5Spwx7DA:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Biden says he is 'heartbroken' and orders flags at the White House to be flown at half-staff in response to Capitol Police officer death","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-white-house-flags-half-staff-capitol-police-officer-death-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/605d989a106eb50019d05bd7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"joe biden\" height=\"2010\" width=\"4020\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Biden said he was &#34;heartbroken&#34; after a Capitol attack left one Capitol Police officer dead.</li>\n<li>A car rammed into a barricade at the Capitol, injuring two officers - one of whom is hospitalized.</li>\n<li>Biden ordered the flags at the White House to be flown at half-staff to honor the officer.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Joe Biden ordered flags at the White House to be flown at half-staff in response to the death of a Capitol Police officer after <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-capitol-is-on-lockdown-over-an-external-security-threat-2021-4\">a car rammed into a barricade outside the Capitol</a> on Friday afternoon.</p><p>Earlier Friday, the Capitol went on lockdown after a vehicle rammed into an outside barricade and injured two officers. One of the officers, identified by the Capitol Police as Officer William Evans, later died from his injuries.</p><p>&#34;Jill and I were heartbroken to learn of the violent attack at a security checkpoint on the US Capitol grounds, which killed Officer William Evans of the US Capitol Police, and left a fellow officer fighting for his life,&#34; Biden said in a statement. &#34;We send our heartfelt condolences to Officer Evans&#39; family, and everyone grieving his loss. We know what a difficult time this has been for the Capitol, everyone who works there, and those who protect it.&#34;</p><p>The suspect was shot and killed by one of the officers after exiting &#34;the car with a knife in hand&#34; and &#34;lunging&#34; at the officers, Yogananda Pittman, the acting Capitol Police chief, said at a press conference. The National Guard was deployed to the Capitol shortly after the incident to assist Capitol Police officers who were lining the perimeter of the building.</p><p>&#34;I want to express the nation&#39;s gratitude to the Capitol Police, the National Guard Immediate Response Force, and others who quickly responded to this attack,&#34; the president said in the statement. &#34;As we mourn the loss of yet another courageous Capitol Police officer, I have ordered that the White House flags be lowered to half-mast.&#34;</p><p>Biden&#39;s move followed <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-ordered-flags-flown-half-staff-capitol-police-officer-died-2021-4\">House Speaker Nancy Pelosi making a similar order to lower the flags</a> at the Capitol to half-staff.</p><p>The lockdown at the Capitol was lifted about 3 p.m. local time.</p><p>Less than three months ago, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-siege-module\">pro-Trump rioters stormed the Capitol</a>, resulting in the deaths of five people - including two Capitol Police officers.</p><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HqijXV5R7sg:Sjh6-pK8dPY:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HqijXV5R7sg:Sjh6-pK8dPY:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HqijXV5R7sg\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 21:36:16 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/606786dea7d803001963e997?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0dd3a0acb10420c94df5248655aae918","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn88@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-41-498_511f08e056d694e5.webp","destWidth":3573,"destHeight":2680,"sourceBytes":271138,"destBytes":271138,"author":"insider@insider.com (Lauren Frias)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/605d989a106eb50019d05bd7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn18@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-57-068_87590d1221a23ad1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HqijXV5R7sg:Sjh6-pK8dPY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-58-496_4e262beb1f3b3e06.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HqijXV5R7sg:Sjh6-pK8dPY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn31@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-49-134_04884434a95496cc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HqijXV5R7sg:Sjh6-pK8dPY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn67@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-54-704_c91117af8cdfc5fd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HqijXV5R7sg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn97@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-53-968_6a83482c336c57ec.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373630},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"SCOTT GALLOWAY: WeWork may be in a unique position to rise from the post-pandemic real estate fallout","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/scott-galloway-the-state-of-commercial-real-estate-beyond-the-pandemic-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675e70856cd700198a2ee9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Clive Wilkinson Architects\" height=\"1041\" width=\"1389\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Over a year of having to adapt to remote services has changed to way people think about work.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Clive Wilkinson Architects</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Scott Galloway is a bestselling author and professor of marketing at NYU Stern.</li>\n<li>The following is a recent blog post, republished with permission, that originally ran on his blog, &#34;<a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\">No Mercy / No Malice.</a>&#34;</li>\n<li>In it, Galloway says commercial vacancy rates will continue to rise long after the pandemic ends.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Real estate is an awesome gig.</p><p>For starters, the supply of fertile land (urban centers) is finite, but the source of demand keeps growing (more people/capital moving to cities). On top of that, we&#39;ve granted real estate development such favorable tax treatment that it is nearly immune from taxation. Even Donald Trump, arguably the worst business person in US history, made money in real estate development, despite the serial failure of the underlying business. As one tax law expert <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/30/business/trump-taxes-real-estate.html?referringSource=articleShare\">put it</a>, the real estate industry &#34;thinks of the tax code as a basket of goodies to feast on rather than a financial obligation of doing business.&#34; Imagine buying stock and being able to depreciate it as it increased in value.</p><p>Thanks to ever-growing demand and favorable tax treatment, real estate once minted more billionaires than tech. In 2019, 223 people on the <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/willyakowicz/2019/03/09/how-the-worlds-billionaires-got-so-rich/#3d4f22966ae6\">Forbes billionaire list</a> owed their wealth to real estate, compared to 214 from tech.</p><p>Then … COVID.</p><p>The third great conveyance of the modern economy (the first two being globalization and digitization) is in full swing: Dispersion, the process of value leapfrogging traditional points of distribution. Three sectors stand to register the greatest reallocation of stakeholder value (i.e., shit-kicking): healthcare, commercial real estate, and education as consumers leapfrog hospitals, HQ, and campuses.</p><p>Dispersion is enabled by both globalization and digitization. High-bandwidth communications link billions of people, and robust mobile devices render that network continuous. Now, blockchain technology is enabling the network to store value (bitcoin) and act on it (etherium). This will bring further disruption to industries low on IQ and heavy on EQ, such as insurance/asset management/central banking (wrapping my head around this is my biggest challenge for 2021).</p><p>The point is, the pandemic has accelerated all of these trends. A year-plus of forced acceptance of remote services in every sector has carved permanent change into our behavior. And, few sectors have seen a more radical transformation than office work.</p><h2>Valuation</h2><p>Any discussion of valuation must be set against the backdrop of a firm&#39;s valuation. Gannett Co., Inc. faces structural challenges, but at a $2.5 billion enterprise value (0.7x revenue), Gannett is undervalued. Tesla is a great product and company, but at $637 billion (20x revenue), it is overvalued (send in the clowns/trolls). Disclosure: I am a shareholder in Gannett and consistently wrong re: Tesla.</p><p>Anyway, the office real estate in the US alone is a $2.5 trillion asset class, and it is going to leak the GDP of Switzerland to residential over the next decade. However, it&#39;s not as easy as going short all office firms and long all residential. The fire that will rage within the office sector will raise seeds of dormancy - and create unexpected winners. One pyrophile plant that emerges from the fire may be WeWork. I&#39;m especially proud of that last sentence.</p><h2>Why We (might) Work</h2><p>The wholesale abandonment of office space has been among the most striking fallouts of the pandemic, and it will have profound effects on the way we live and work, long after the virus has been tamed. In New York, new office space is coming on the market 59% leased, down from 74% pre-COVID. San Francisco went from its lowest-ever office vacancy rate to its highest in the same year, and office rents are set to decline by 15%. The worst may be yet to come. Analysts predict that commercial<a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/news/3657404-struggles-ahead-for-us-office-sector-vacancy-rates-seen-rising-in-2021\"> vacancy</a> rates will rise from 17.1% in 2020 to 19.4% in 2021, besting the previous high of 17.6% in 2010. And, as <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2020-commercial-real-estate/?sref=AhQQoPzF\">$430 billion</a> in commercial and multifamily real estate debt matures in 2021, lenders will be forced to reconcile the effect of the pandemic on their investments.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6067579c856cd700198a2ec0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway.\" height=\"963\" width=\"1560\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606757df856cd700198a2ec2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"867\" width=\"1560\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>These changes will endure. Twitter, Facebook, and Slack have all announced the move to a predominantly remote workforce. Pinterest recently paid $90 million to terminate its HQ lease in San Francisco. <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/12/rei-seattle-headquarters-commercial-real-estate/\">REI</a> sold its new headquarters before even moving in, and <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/10/1-year-into-covid-employers-rethink-offices-and-function-matters-most.html\">CVS</a> plans to cut 30% of its office space. At my New York-based education startup, Section4, we asked employees if they wanted to come back to work after the pandemic; overwhelmingly, they wanted to stay home. We paid $1 million to terminate our SoHo office lease. After decades of promise, the telecommuting revolution is here.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675902a7d803001963e818?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"1083\" width=\"1560\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Back in 2017, I predicted <a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/retails-anti-christ/\">WeWork</a>, then worth $16 billion, would lose 75% of its value and become the &#34;poster child of unicorn mania.&#34; Two and a half years later, that prediction was wrong, very wrong - WeWork was preparing to go public on the heels of a $1 billion investment from Softbank that valued the company at $47 billion.</p><p>But it just didn&#39;t pencil out. After deploying my unique domain expertise (math) I concluded: &#34;Any equity analyst who endorses this stock above a $10 billion valuation is lying, stupid, or both.&#34;</p><p>The ensuing meltdown was cinematic - literally. Tonight, WeWork gets its closeup, in a documentary on Hulu, &#34;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Fmovie%2Fwework-or-the-making-and-breaking-of-a-47-billion-unicorn-c6deead3-f45f-43c6-b8bf-fc56e9f8a589\">The Making and Breaking of a $47 Billion Unicorn</a>.&#34; I&#39;m in it. I have not seen it, but it is awesome.</p><p>(BTW, the production company wanted me to come to a studio in New Jersey for filming. I told them I had a two hour window and that they needed to come to my place in SoHo or find another angry professor to make terse comments. They shuttled a dozen people to my place and set up a studio in my kids room, next to the climbing wall. At that moment, I realized that people tolerating you being an asshole doesn&#39;t make you … any less of an asshole.)</p><p>Anyway, that wasn&#39;t the end of the story of WeWork. Despite losing $60 million per week of Softbank&#39;s money in 2020, WeWork didn&#39;t go out of business. Instead, to the board&#39;s credit, the company fired the Jesus of reclaimed wood and smoked glass, Adam Neumann, and brought in an experienced manager. Sandeep Mathrani shed 100 of the company&#39;s worst performing properties along with the self-dealing arrangements foisted on the company by Neumann, and laid off 8,000 employees. A crisis is a terrible thing to waste, and if WeWork turns the corner to profitability in Q4 of this year, as it has promised investors, it will be the case study in fire intensity and germination.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed522853f7370106214bbd4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sandeep Mathrani\" height=\"1764\" width=\"2352\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sandeep Mathrani of WeWork.\n<p class=\"copyright\">WeWork</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The new WeWork is a stronger company than the 2017 model. It&#39;s still not worth $50 billion, but it might be worth $9B (or more). The new WeWork will benefit from the massive investments in space and brand equity (i.e., global awareness); additionally, people underestimate the difficulty of scaling &#34;vibe,&#34; where WeWork has a proven talent.</p><p>Most companies aren&#39;t going 100% remote. But when we return to the office, we will want less space that is more flexible, and more appealing to the premier asset of any firm: its ability to attract skilled, young human capital. Pre-corona, Section4 had a long term lease on 8,000 feet at $70 per square foot. Post-corona, it will probably be closer to 2,000 at $100, and on a year-to-year lease. Further out, I could see us opening offices in Miami or Austin, where great talent is migrating.</p><p>Imagine: a commercial real estate play, with properties around the world, configured as flexible office space, rentable by the hour, the day, or the month, with great community spaces, aspirational design, and strong tech. In sum, We might Work.</p><h2>Pass the pipe (here we go … again)</h2><p>However, Softbank has not run out of real estate opium quite yet. Now it is trying to pass the pipe to Compass investors, hoping the markets enter into consensual hallucination that a rollup of residential real estate brokerages is (wait for it) a tech company. Yesterday, Compass went public at a valuation of approximately 3x revenue. Realogy, the closest competitor, trades at 0.29x revenue. From the Compass site:</p><p><em>&#34;Compass is building the first modern real estate platform, pairing the industry&#39;s top talent with technology to make the search and sell experience intelligent and seamless.&#34;</em></p><p>The firm even describes itself as &#34;a tech company reinventing the space,&#34; despite the fact that it spent 78% of expenses on commissions to brokers, instead of technology or algorithms. This makes sense as Compass is … a real estate brokerage.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6067593b856cd700198a2ec6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"903\" width=\"1560\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Just before the IPO, the underwriters cut the pricing range and halved the number of shares offered.  Despite a massive haircut in supply, the first day pop was an anemic 12%. I&#39;ve worked at an investment bank taking companies public, founded companies that have gone public, and been on boards of companies going public. Dramatically reduced supply (shares) at a lower price, coupled with Goldman&#39;s unparalleled institutional base of buyers, and Compass barely got out. In sum, the corners of this trade are beginning to collapse and could lead to a broken IPO within days. WeWork may be rising from the ashes as Compass begins to smolder.</p><p>Life is so rich,</p><p>Scott</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 43@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-42-091_2384d5e4d27cd7c0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373825},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"See video footage of the scene where a car crashed into a barricade outside the Capitol","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/watch-video-footage-from-scene-of-car-crash-outside-capitol-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675acfa7d803001963e82a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Capitol car crash\" height=\"888\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Capitol Police officers stand near a car that crashed into a barrier on Capitol Hill on Friday.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Scott J. Applewhite/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Two Capitol Police officers were injured when a car crashed into a barrier outside the complex on Friday.</li>\n<li>The Capitol Police said that one of the officers died and that a suspect was shot and killed.</li>\n<li>See footage of the scene below.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Two Capitol Police officers were injured, one fatally, on Friday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-capitol-is-on-lockdown-over-an-external-security-threat-2021-4\">when a car crashed into a barricade</a> outside an entrance to the Capitol, the agency said.</p><p>The barricade is on Constitution Avenue across the street from Senate office buildings. On Friday afternoon, when the House and the Senate were out of session, staffers were notified that the complex was on lockdown because of an &#34;external security threat.&#34;</p><p>Yogananda Pittman, the acting chief of the Capitol Police, and Robert Contee, the chief of the Metropolitan Police Department, said in a news conference that one officer had died and that a suspect had been shot and killed.</p><p>&#34;It is with a very, very heavy heart that I announced one of our officers has succumbed to his injuries,&#34; Pittman said. The officer&#39;s identity has not been made public.</p><p>Footage captured by Fox News&#39; Jacqui Heinrich showed the aftermath of the crash.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\"
