href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8goH83blfhU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 18:15:50 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60675ca9856cd700198a2ee1?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"1f98f8dfa4622924ece4ecbd9ff86490","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn63@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-41-315_fe2b8de2dd225ef3.webp","destWidth":1776,"destHeight":1332,"sourceBytes":262604,"destBytes":262604,"author":"gpanetta@businessinsider.com (Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60675acfa7d803001963e82a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-57-512_5d699f05bf292032.webp","https://i.insider.com/60676386856cd700198a2f27?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn31@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-44-424_ce821a57193d098c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn27@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-51-584_fd75f62f7cf8ff8f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn27@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-43-210_a29084d7352c3f8e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8goH83blfhU:lUAYc8Zl1yI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn99@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-49-024_81736c651ac5573d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8goH83blfhU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn79@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-42-689_b4878236085a4feb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373986},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Marines are looking for trigger-finger mittens and other 'snivel gear' to survive extreme cold weather","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/marines-want-trigger-finger-mittens-snivel-gear-for-extreme-cold-2021-4","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675f42a7d803001963e840?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Marine Norway Arctic\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   US Marines hike through snow during a cold weather live-fire training event in Setermoen, Norway, November 20, 2020. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">US Marine Corps/Cpl. William Chockey</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>The Marine Corps is looking for better cold-weather clothing, known to troops as snivel gear.</li> \n <li>The search for new mittens, long underwear, and hats, comes as the US military focuses more on operations in the Arctic.</li> \n <li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider's business page</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p><a href=\"http://www.military.com/marine-corps\">Marine Corps</a> equipment officials are looking for new extreme cold weather gear for combat units training to fight in subzero Arctic conditions.</p>\n<p>Starting in late February, Marine Corps Systems Command began looking at the commercial cold weather gear market for new trigger finger mittens, base-layer long underwear and a hat that sounds like a modern version of the beloved GI pile cap, according to three request-for-information solicitations.</p>\n<p>This latest search for better cold weather clothing - long known as snivel gear in the ranks - comes at a time when the US military is <a href=\"https://www.military.com/podcasts/left-of-boom/2021/01/04/us-losing-fight-arctic-dominance.html\">intensifying its focus on the Arctic</a> to counter potential aggression from Russia and China as melting ice is opening new sea lanes.</p>\n<p>The Marines want ideas on a new USMC Trigger Finger Mitten System that will replace the current Extreme Cold Weather Mitten Shell &amp; Liner, according to a March 3 solicitation. Trigger finger mittens offer the warmth of a mitten while featuring a separate trigger finger so combat troops can still fire their weapons.</p>\n<p>\"The trigger finger design shall enable the wearer to move their first finger independently from the rest of the hand, but if needed move their first finger into the larger finger compartment to warm up as needed,\" according to the solicitation.</p>\n<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675e41856cd700198a2ee8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Marine Norway Arctic M27 rifle\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   A US Marine fires at enemy targets with an M27 infantry automatic rifle during a cold-weather live-fire training event in Setermoen, Norway, November 20, 2020. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">US Marine Corps/Cpl. William Chockey</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>The mitten shell should be constructed from a waterproof laminate with a water-repellent leather palm and feature a suede \"nose wipe\" on the back of the thumb, according to the solicitation. It should also be insulated and seam-sealed to provide full waterproofing.</p>\n<p>The liner should fit easily into the shell, and the trigger finger should be constructed from leather for \"enhanced dexterity,\" the document states. In addition to increased insulation, the liner should be water resistant and have a cuff to allow for a snug fit around the wrist. Interested companies had until March 24 to respond.</p>\n<p>Marines typically wear the current-issue microfleece cap in cold weather, but the service now wants a new cold weather cap to be \"worn separately from the current cap when increased protection from wet and dry cold weather environments is needed,\" according to a March 1 solicitation.</p>\n<p>\"The design consists of a three-panel crown, short visor that can be worn in either up or down position, and full extension ear flaps that secure under the chin with low profile hook and loop,\" the solicitation states.</p>\n<p>Marines and soldiers wore a similar hat known as the GI pile cap from World War II well past the end of the Cold War. The beloved item was phased out of service in the early 1990s as fleece caps came on the market.</p>\n<p>The lining and shell of the new cap should be designed so they can be separated to help them dry faster, the solicitation states. Interested companies had until March 24 to respond.</p>\n<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675e3ba7d803001963e83a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Marine Norway Arctic Polar\" height=\"1222\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   US Marines participate in the Polar Plunge as a part of extreme-cold weather training in Setermoen, Norway, March 19, 2021. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">US Marine Corps/Cpl. Andrew J. Smith</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>The service is also looking for a new next-to-skin mesh base layer for the Marine Corps Mountain <a href=\"http://www.military.com/equipment/extended-climate-warfighter-clothing-system-gen-iii\">Cold Weather Clothing System</a>, according to a February 23 solicitation.</p>\n<p>\"The mesh base layer will be a supplement to the current Marine Corps layering system to improve moisture regulation and thermal performance in extreme cold weather environments,\" according to the solicitation.</p>\n<p>The undershirt will be an open, netlike knit construction with jersey knit shoulder areas; jersey knit underarm gussets; a rib knit collar and cuffs; and a turned bottom hem, the document states. The drawers, or pants, will be made of the same style of fabric and feature jersey knit reinforced knee patches; jersey knit inner thigh gussets; a tapered, two-ply functional fly; an elastic waistband with a drawstring cord; and rib knit ankle cuffs.</p>\n<p>The materials for the new base layer \"must be no melt/no drip,\" durable, lightweight, moisture-wicking and quick-drying with \"antimicrobial, stretch, and recovery properties,\" according to the solicitation. Interested firms had until March 12 to respond.</p>\n<p>So far, all three cold weather items are slated to come in coyote brown.</p>\n<p>The Marine Corps did not have specific fielding dates planned, but Marine Corps Systems Command spokeswoman Kelly Flynn told Military.com that the service hopes to field all three items either later this year or in early 2022.</p>\n<p><em>- Matthew Cox can be reached at <a href=\"mailto:matthew.cox@military.com\">matthew.cox@military.com</a>.</em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marines-want-trigger-finger-mittens-snivel-gear-for-extreme-cold-2021-4\">Business Insider</a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"feedflare\"> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n</div>\n<img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aBlBBeLKePk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 18:23:44 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60676021856cd700198a2ef0?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5b1bb5ec1f75ad53d2018169f2f1fb8c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn92@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-41-504_7c3d6bed0deef838.webp","destWidth":1629,"destHeight":1222,"sourceBytes":102520,"destBytes":102520,"author":"insider@insider.com (Matthew Cox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60675f42a7d803001963e840?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn90@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-54-110_cd2980c468ea236c.webp","https://i.insider.com/60675e41856cd700198a2ee8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn19@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-47-772_1481fc61aa98002e.webp","https://i.insider.com/60675e3ba7d803001963e83a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn73@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-56-860_29c78be195bdcd18.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn16@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-46-206_514118cf9256f445.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn76@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-49-555_f0d0d713202a9b3b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aBlBBeLKePk:mlbzGuntG1E:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn82@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-58-198_0fe38e53884fffba.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aBlBBeLKePk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn76@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-47-283_2283df9b0092b66b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373947},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"People are buying and selling crypto collectibles in a $250 million market - check out the sites where you can browse and bid on NFTs","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/nft-marketplaces-where-to-buy-sell-non-fungible-tokens-online-2021-3","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047a94944d8e300117b9d9a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Looking Glass Factory allows people to sell their holograms as NFTs\" height=\"786\" width=\"1049\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Looking Glass Factory allows people to sell their holograms as NFTs\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://lookingglassfactory.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Looking Glass Factory</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>NFTs account for a rapidly growing market that is valued at $250 million.</li>\n<li>NFTs have sold for millions, while those who flip NFTs have made nearly 1,000% profit in some cases.</li>\n<li>NFT marketplaces encompass anything from digital art to trading cards, virtual games or real estate.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit the Business section of Insider for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Non-fungible tokens or NFTs - <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-does-nft-mean-crytpo-non-fungible-tokens-art-explained-2021-2\">products that operate as digital assets</a> - have grown to encompass a $250 million market, according to a <a href=\"https://nonfungible.com/nft-report-2020\">2020 report</a> from tech-tracking company L&#39;Atelier BNP Paribas and nonfungible.com.</p><p>Investments in NFTs <a href=\"https://news.bitcoin.com/blockchain-backed-nft-market-value-grew-299-in-2020/\">rose 299% in 2020</a>, gaining popularity as cryptocurrencies like <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-btc-price-record-high-market-cap-cryptocurrency-1-trillion-2021-2-1030096685\">Bitcoin continued to boom</a>, according to the report. In the past 30 days alone, NFT Marketplaces have generated over $1 billion in sales, according to <a href=\"https://www.cryptoslam.io/\">CryptoSlam.</a></p><p>NFT creators and resellers have made millions. In March, artist Beeple smashed digital art records and became one of the most valuable living artists <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/art-auction-nft-beeple-top-selling-most-expensive-sale-millions-2021-3\">when he sold a crypto art piece for nearly $70 million.</a></p><p>Crypto art flippers have also made headlines with record sales. In February, an art collector <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/retail-trading-nfts/insight-how-a-10-second-video-clip-sold-for-6-6-million-idUKL8N2KV6X9\">sold a 10-second video artwork for $6.6 million</a> after buying the Beeple project for $67,000 in October - nearly a 1,000% profit.</p><p>NFTs encompass anything from digital trading cards and art to virtual real estate and gaming. </p><p>Unlike popular cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether, NFTs cannot be directly exchanged with one another and are spread out across numerous different types of platforms.</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nft-startups-non-fungible-tokens-the-art-world-2021-3\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">Here are 4 NFT startups transforming the way we buy art and sports memorabilia</a></em></p><p>Most NFT platforms require buyers to have a digital wallet and use cryptocurrencies platforms like Ethereum, World Asset eXchange (WAX) or Flow. </p><p>Here&#39;s what you need to know about where to buy and sell NFTs. </p><h2>Digital art has brought in millions for creators and sellers</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c0642db4af00117e4596?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Winkelmann&#39;s &#34;Crossroads&#34; was resold for $6.6 million off Nifty Gateway\" height=\"694\" width=\"925\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mike Winkelmann&#39;s &#34;Crossroads&#34; was resold for $6.6 million off Nifty Gateway\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://niftygateway.com/itemdetail/secondary/0x12f28e2106ce8fd8464885b80ea865e98b465149/100010001\" target=\"_blank\">Nifty Gateway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Most digital-art trading platforms allow creators to gather a royalty. Some art platforms are more exclusive, while others focus on letting anyone create and sell their art.</p><p>For professional digital artists, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nft-artists-make-millions-traditional-galleries-adapt-cryptoart-2021-3\">NFTs have opened creators to a windfall of profit.</a> NFT artist Trevor Jones <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nft-artists-make-millions-traditional-galleries-adapt-cryptoart-2021-3\">told Insider</a> that digital-art trading platforms could make more traditional art markets obsolete.</p><p>Some traditional auction houses have already started to get in on NFTs. In February, Christie&#39;s - an auction house that was founded in 1766 - made its first foray into digital tokens with the $69 million Beeple sale. Since then, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sothebys-nft-art-sales-pak-auction-2021-3\">famed auction house Sotheby&#39;s has also announced plans to sell NFTs.</a></p><p>For multimillion-dollar digital artists like Mike Winkelmann - more commonly known as Beeple -  platforms like <a href=\"https://superrare.co/\">Super Rare</a>, <a href=\"https://foundation.app/\">Foundation</a>, and <a href=\"https://niftygateway.com/\">Nifty Gateway</a> allow buyers to pick from carefully curated work. Nifty Gateway co-founders Duncan and Griffin Cock Foster told Insider their company works one-on-one with artists.</p><p>&#34;One of the coolest things about Nifty Gateway is that there are all these artists who basically only existed on Instagram or Twitter who were creating all this really special work, but never had a way to make money from it,&#34; Griffin Cock Foster told Insider. &#34;They started selling crypto art and they&#39;re already starting to see some benefits and recognition.&#34;</p><p>Platforms like Nifty Gateway, Super Rare, and Foundation have been home to names like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/grimes-nft-art-warnymph-sells-for-millions-20-minutes-2021-3\">Grimes</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ethereum-nft-meme-art-nyan-cat-sells-for-300-eth-2021-2\">digital comic artist Chris Torres.</a> These platforms provide artists with around 10% royalties on any future sales of their work.</p><h2>Other digital art platforms have less restrictions</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c1272db4af00117e459b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mark Cuban announced he was selling his own line of NFTs on Rarible in January.\" height=\"462\" width=\"688\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mark Cuban announced he was selling his own line of NFTs on Rarible in January.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://rarible.com/token/0xd07dc4262bcdbf85190c01c996b4c06a461d2430:113075:0xa679c6154b8d4619af9f83f0bf9a13a680e01ecf\" target=\"_blank\">Rarible</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>While Nifty Gateway strives to be more accessible to buyers by allowing them to use a credit card to purchase items off the site, other platforms focus on having a lower barrier to entry for creators.</p><p>Platforms like <a href=\"https://zora.co/\">Zora</a> operate as invite-only, while <a href=\"https://rarible.com/\">Rarible</a> and <a href=\"https://mintable.app/\">Mintable</a> allow any user to upload and sell images and text as NFTs on the site.</p><p>These sites still allow artists to garner royalties, but are much less curated. Creators on Rarible can upload anything from blank images to their own interpretations of famous art pieces.</p><p>One NFT creator on Rarible, <a href=\"https://www.kapwing.com/resources/how-to-create-and-sell-nft-crypto-art/\">Robert Martin</a>, said he thinks the sites need to develop more security, but says he has been pleased with how easy it was to upload content on Rarible.</p><p>&#34;The site and their moderation of copyrighted and offensive uploads needs some improvement,&#34; Martin told Insider.</p><p>These sites sell NFTs from anywhere from $10 to hundreds of thousands of dollars.</p><h2>OpenSea is a catch-all platform for NFTs</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c1bc2db4af00117e459d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"OpenSea sells a wide variety of NFTs, including CryptoKitties.\" height=\"727\" width=\"1502\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>OpenSea sells a wide variety of NFTs, including CryptoKitties.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://opensea.io/assets/cryptokitties\" target=\"_blank\">OpenSea</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><a href=\"https://opensea.io/\">OpenSea</a> claims to be the largest NFT marketplace and is home to anything from art to virtual reality, sports and trading cards. The site has over 200 categories and 4 million items. </p><p>People looking to buy popular NFT items like CryptoPunks, CryptoKitties, or virtual real estate can use ether to buy items off OpenSea. <a href=\"https://dappradar.com/blog/top-7-nft-marketplaces-beginners-guide\">DappRadar</a>, a site that tracks and analyzes decentralized applications, calls OpenSea &#34;the eBay on the blockchain.&#34;</p><p>Several marketplaces also operate off OpenSea, including Decentraland, a popular virtual real-estate site. OpenSea has sold nearly $28 million in NFTs over the past week, according to DappRadar.</p><h2><strong>Sports also account for a large portion of NFT sales</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c25b44d8e300117b9e3d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sports clips sell for anywhere from $20 to thousands of dollars on NBA Top Shot.\" height=\"821\" width=\"1213\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sports clips sell for anywhere from $20 to thousands of dollars on NBA Top Shot.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.nbatopshot.com/search?bySetVisuals=SET_VISUAL_RARE\" target=\"_blank\">NBA Top Shot</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.nbatopshot.com/\">NBA Top Shot</a>, a site where people can buy video highlights as NFTs, has sold over $260 million in NFTs in the past month, according to <a href=\"https://www.cryptoslam.io/\">CryptoSlam</a>. </p><p>In February, a<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nba-top-shot-virtual-highlights-for-sale-moments-blockchain-explained-2021-2\"> LeBron James dunk set the record for the most expensive Top Shot sales at $208,000 worth of the cryptocurrency Flow.</a></p><p>Fantasy sports has also taken a chunk of NFT sales. The site <a href=\"https://sorare.com/\">Sorare</a> operates as a fantasy soccer game, where people can buy, sell, and manage virtual teams via digital player cards.</p><p>The platform was founded in 2018, but has recently taken off. Sorare sold over $14 million in ether last month, according to CryptoSlam.</p><h2>NFTs offer opportunities for gamers and trading-card collectors</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c3032db4af00117e45a2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Axie Infinity provides NFTs that cater to the gaming community.\" height=\"926\" width=\"1235\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Axie Infinity provides NFTs that cater to the gaming community.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://axieinfinity.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Axie Infinity</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><a href=\"https://axieinfinity.com/\">Axie Infinity</a>, a site that sells cartoon characters that are created to fight, much like Pokémon, is one of the top 10 most popular crypto-collectible platforms, according to CryptoSlam. </p><p>The site had over 10,000 monthly active users in 2020, making it the most popular game on Ethereum, according to <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/nft-game-axie-infinity-axs-governance-token-sale\">CoinDesk</a>.</p><p>Other NFT collectibles based on arcade games like <a href=\"https://www.streetfighter.cards/\">Street Fighter</a> have also gained popularity - generating over $1.5 million only weeks after the site was launched and over $600,000 in the past month, according to CryptoSlam data.</p><p>NFT gaming is expected to continue to grow. In February, Altitude Games <a href=\"https://medium.com/arkane-network/launching-the-matic-nft-market-with-battle-racers-2-2-2021-358da09092e0\">launched</a> a blockchain racing game called Battle Racers on the <a href=\"https://arkane.network/\">Arkane Market</a>, a site that is home to over <a href=\"https://arkane.network/\">100,000 gamers</a> on the blockchain.</p><p>Other popular trading card and memorabilia sites include <a href=\"https://myth.market/\">Myth.Market</a> and <a href=\"https://treasureland.market/\">Treasureland</a>.</p><h2>Virtual real estate is booming </h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c37644d8e300117b9e49?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Decentraland allows users to buy and sell virtual real estate.\" height=\"610\" width=\"1309\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Decentraland allows users to buy and sell virtual real estate.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://play.decentraland.org/?realm=unicorn-blue\" target=\"_blank\">Decentraland</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Digital real estate might be the next big area for investment, according to the co-head of Republic Real Estate <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/here-comes-the-virtual-real-estate-boom\">Janine Yorio</a>.</p><p>On Friday, one of the first NFT digital houses in the world sold for over <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ProductHunt/status/1378021791512227845\">$500,000 on SuperRare&#39;s marketplace</a>.</p><p>NFT sites that capitalize on virtual reality and real estate also include <a href=\"https://decentraland.org/\">Decentraland</a>, which is built on Ethereum and owned and created by users. </p><p>Decentraland operates as a multiplayer role-playing game and allows users to build an entire virtual world as an NFT. Yorio calls it a more sophisticated &#34;SimCity,&#34; &#34;Minecraft,&#34; or &#34;Fortnite.&#34;</p><p>In March, Atari, the gaming company known for &#34;PAC-MAN,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/atari-casino-decentral-games-crypto\">announced</a> plans to develop a cryptocurrency casino in Decentraland.</p><p>Decentraland&#39;s internal currency, &#34;MANA,&#34; has a $225 million market value. MANA prices have risen over 321% in the past year, according to Yorio.</p><h2>There are several niche NFT marketplaces</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6047c39944d8e300117b9e4a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jack Dorsey\" height=\"1999\" width=\"2666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Burhaan Kinu/Hindustan Times via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In March, Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-ceo-jack-dorsey-sell-first-tweet-nft-sunday-2021-3\">sold the site&#39;s first tweet as an NFT for $2.9 million. </a> After Dorsey&#39;s announcement Tesla CEO Elon Musk teased he would sell an NFT, but later <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/elon-musk-nft-non-fungible-token-tweet-for-1-million-2021-3-1030218330\">turned down a $1 million offer for his tweet.</a></p><p>The site, <a href=\"https://v.cent.co/\">Valuables</a>, allows anyone to auction off their tweet for payment in the form of ether. The platform focuses solely on selling tweets as NFTs.</p><p>Many sites have found success in niche NFT collectible markets, including <a href=\"https://lookingglassfactory.com/\">Looking Glass Factory</a>, a site that generates digital holograms and allows them to be sold as tokens. </p><p>One person, Petter Rudwall, has even put himself up for <a href=\"https://mintable.app/collectibles/item/Immortalized-on-the-blockchain-Buy-the-first-human-on-the-blockchain/R3ajgXBwwgypC0-\">auction</a> on Mintable. Rudwall told Insider the NFT includes his own personal information, including birth date, weight, as well as social media accounts.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 12:49:34","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:34","title":"The 25 best New York City hotels, including affordable Midtown stays, luxury downtown suites, and boutique Brooklyn gems","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hotels-new-york-city","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>If you buy through our links, we may earn money from affiliate partners. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=biip_121919_best-new-york-hotels&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fsister-city-new-york.en-gb.html%3Faid%3D356980%3B-1DCAso7AFCFHNpc3Rlci1jaXR5LW5ldy15b3JrSDNYA2inAogBAZgBCbgBB8gBDNgBA-gBAYgCAagCA7gC5JWn7QXAAgE%3Bsid%3Dbfa55eda84819cf7a03f3934985c9771%3Bdist%3D0%26group_adults%3D2%26keep_landing%3D1%26sb_price_type%3Dtotal%26type%3Dtotal%26%26page_reload%3D1%26aid%3D898409%26label%3Daffnetawin-index_pub-257137_site-1576790735978aaanpj3p2_pname-Business%2BInsider_plc-_ts-_clkid-6776_1576794537_51ce3a512537f17ff4f9c5a3fe00ec51%26awc%3D6776_1576794537_51ce3a512537f17ff4f9c5a3fe00ec51%26utm_source%3Daffnetawin%26utm_medium%3D%26utm_term%3Dindex%26utm_content%3D257137ent%3D257137\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db0bfeddee01911006c7292?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sister City: An affordable boutique hotel in New York\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Booking.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>As vaccines roll out and warmer weather arrives, it&#39;s time to reconsider a visit to New York City. </li></ul><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>We chose the best New York City hotels in 2021 at a range of prices, from Manhattan to Brooklyn.</li><li>We personally visited, reviewed, and photographed every hotel on this list.</li></ul><p>I review hotels for a living and lived in New York for over 10 years, so when friends and family plan a visit, they&#39;re quick to ask, &#34;where should I stay?&#34;</p><p>It&#39;s a loaded question. The city is filled with hundreds of hotels, from old-school Manhattan luxury to neighborhood-centric boutique Brooklyn gems. Big brands have flagships, and micro hotels offer small spaces for cheap.</p><p>To narrow the field, we stayed at, toured, and researched the city&#39;s top-rated hotels to determine which offer the best value, guest experience, and location. We take all our own photos, too, so you know what you&#39;re really getting. This list is updated regularly to reflect new additions and pricing.</p><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Every hotel was personally reviewed, vetted, and selected based on the following criteria:</strong> </p><ol><li>Each hotel was visited and personally reviewed and vetted by Insider Reviews&#39; team of travel writers over the course of a one-night stay.</li><li>Hotels are located in desirable neighborhoods in New York City, with a primary focus on Manhattan and Brooklyn.</li><li>They are considered a four- or five-star hotel, for an elevated experience that won&#39;t disappoint, or a three-star that&#39;s a total standout.</li><li>Holds a Trip Advisor rating of four or above, as many tourists check and use it.</li><li>It starts between $79 to $675 per night, depending on the time of year. </li><li>The hotel boasts attractive amenities such as unique design, architecture, food, or other experiential elements that add value. </li><li>The hotel promotes stringent COVID-19 policies to prioritize the health and safety of all guests.</li></ol></aside><p><strong>Browse all the best hotels in New York City below, or jump directly to a specific area here:</strong></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hotels-new-york-city#arlo-soho-1\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"38dd6370a430499ad35dc93a347f0a17\">The best hotels in New York City</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hotels-new-york-city#our-methodology-for-selecting-hotels-26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Our methodology for selecting hotels</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hotels-new-york-city#more-of-the-best-hotels-in-new-york-city-27\">More of the best boutique, cheap, and luxury hotels in New York City</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hotels-new-york-city#is-it-safe-to-stay-in-hotels-right-now-28\">FAQs: Everything you should know about booking a New York City hotel</a></li></ul><h2>Here are the best New York City hotels, sorted by price from low to high.</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tArlo SoHo\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db1af53dee0197dd93bf602?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1. Arlo SoHo shades open\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jen Gushue/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biip_121919_best-new-york-hotels&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Farlo-soho.en-gb.html%3Faid%3D356980%3Blabel%3Dgog235jc-1DCAso7AFCCWFybG8tc29ob0gzWANopwKIAQGYAQm4AQfIAQzYAQPoAQGIAgGoAgO4Atnv9O8FwAIB%3Bsid%3Daa37617f285310a3e4899f2ab43f877c%3Bdist%3D0%26group_adults%3D2%26group_children%3D0%26keep_landing%3D1%26no_rooms%3D1%26sb_price_type%3Dtotal%26type%3Dtotal%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book Arlo SoHo</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Budget</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> SoHo</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$79/$299</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Solo and business travelers, couples</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Restaurant, four bars, co-working and lounge spaces &#8212; all quite Instagrammable</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Cheap room prices and cool SoHo location</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> The room sizes can feel shockingly small and bathrooms lack privacy</p></aside><p>Arlo SoHo seeks to popularize the trend of micro hotels with sleek, tiny rooms measuring barely 150 square feet. And we mean tiny. You can likely reach the bathroom from your bed, and there's little by way of privacy.</p><p>But, what it lacks in size, Arlo makes up for with bustling common spaces and a low starting price point of $79, which a great deal for typically expensive SoHo, though prices in the summer are often closer to $190.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.arlohotels.com/rest-assured-policy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/arlo-soho-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review of Arlo SoHo</a></h3>\n\tGild Hall, a Thompson Hotel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e6f91e7c48540318a3acfe3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gild Hall   Guestroom   King Premiuim\" height=\"3378\" width=\"4504\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>One of Gild Hall&#39;s Premium King rooms.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Anna Karon (Kinship)</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fgild-hall-thompson.html%3Faid%3D356281%3Blabel%3Dmetatripad-link-dmetaus-hotel-59038_xqdz-94cedff6a8166da25c76b5175cb82a6c_los-01_bw-055_dom-com_curr-USD_gst-01_nrm-01_clkid-Xm%2540RkQokHxwAAarlQj4AAABG_aud-0000_mbl-L_pd-B_sc-2_defdate-0_spo-0_clksrc-0%3Bsid%3Daa37617f285310a3e4899f2ab43f877c%3Ball_sr_blocks%3D5903816_91459238_2_2_0%3Bcheckin%3D2020-05-10%3Bcheckout%3D2020-05-11%3Bdest_id%3D20088325%3Bdest_type%3Dcity%3Bdist%3D0%3Bgroup_adults%3D1%3Bgroup_children%3D0%3Bhapos%3D1%3Bhighlighted_blocks%3D5903816_91459238_2_2_0%3Bhpos%3D1%3Bno_rooms%3D1%3Breq_adults%3D1%3Breq_children%3D0%3Broom1%3DA%3Bsb_price_type%3Dtotal%3Bsr_order%3Dpopularity%3Bsr_pri_blocks%3D5903816_91459238_2_2_0__19019%3Bsrepoch%3D1584370069%3Bsrpvid%3Da87e680a3dc300cc%3Btype%3Dtotal%3Bucfs%3D1%26%23hotelTmpl&#38;clickref=1617027614298am7nsnfja|xid:fr1617027618112jhg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-ml-dynamic=\"true\" data-ml-dynamic-type=\"sl\" data-ml-id=\"8\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1617027618112jhg\" data-uri=\"8824687c2db6b128086fe02c80eec306\">Book Gild Hall</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Boutique</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Financial District</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$97/$318</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Business travelers</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Nice restaurant, extremely small gym</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong>&#160;Intricate design and decor that stands in sharp contrast to neighborhood surroundings, but in a good way.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong>&#160;Starter rooms can be small, and on-site amenities as well, in particular, the gym.</p></aside><p>Gild Hall, a Thompson Hotel from World of Hyatt, offers much more personality than the typical Financial District hotel. Warm and welcoming, the cozy decor is inspired by Aspen country houses for an overall rustic vibe. Details such as tufted leather, dark wood, and brass accents are woven throughout the property, as well as a lobby chandelier fashioned out of antlers.</p><p>It's an interesting, out-of-the-box option for an otherwise corporate neighborhood.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a Rooms can feel small for two people</p></aside><p>Sister City is a new spin-off property from the creative studio behind Ace Hotel that caters to the experienced, and busy, traveler. Self-service tablets guide guests through check-in, while amenities and housekeeping are on demand.</p><p>It's a smart approach for savvy guests looking to avoid the pain points of crowded, more traditional hotels and prefer an individualistic approach.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are not yet available as <a href=\"https://sistercitynyc.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this Sister City New York</a></h3>\n\tThe Knickerbocker\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5daf718b4af9090f82217a8b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Knick bed\" height=\"930\" width=\"1200\" href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biip_121919_best-new-york-hotels&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fthe-knickerbocker.en-gb.html%3Faid%3D811995%3Blabel%3Daffnetcj-12937048_pub-3861930_site-6415797_pname-Business%2520Insider_clkid-_cjevent-48cdd78f22ae11ea83c200110a240610%3Bsid%3Daa37617f285310a3e4899f2ab43f877c%3Ball_sr_blocks%3D131532105_86217378_0_42_0%3Bcheckin%3D2020-01-05%3Bcheckout%3D2020-01-06%3Bdest_id%3D20088325%3Bdest_type%3Dcity%3Bdist%3D0%3Bgroup_adults%3D1%3Bgroup_children%3D0%3Bhapos%3D1%3Bhighlighted_blocks%3D131532105_86217378_0_42_0%3Bhpos%3D1%3Bno_rooms%3D1%3Breq_adults%3D1%3Breq_children%3D0%3Broom1%3DA%3Bsb_price_type%3Dtotal%3Bsr_order%3Dpopularity%3Bsr_pri_blocks%3D131532105_86217378_0_42_0__24700%3Bsrepoch%3D1576794256%3Bsrpvid%3Dbaa19d874e8300a7%3Btype%3Dtotal%3Bucfs%3D1%26%23hotelTmpl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book the Knickerbocker Hotel</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Luxury</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Times Square</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$164/$351</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Tourists, families, business travelers</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Celebrity chef-helmed restaurant, rooftop bar, and a nice gym&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Luxury-leaning hotel in Times Square with nicer rooms than many nearby counterparts for roughly the same price</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> It's Times Square, so it can be noisy both from outside traffic and inside from fellow guests</p></aside><p>The Knick is one of the nicer hotels in Times Square. Rooms are spacious, with a minimal look, but feel significantly higher-end thanks to zen-inducing bathrooms and generous floor plans, especially when compared to many of the big brand counterparts in this tourist mecca.</p><p>There's also good on-site food and drink, including a great rooftop bar overlooking the action. If you're booking a room in Times Square, you're likely spending most of your time outside of it, but The Knick is a great option for those who want a chic place to retreat.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://theknickerbocker.com/covid-19/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-knickerbocker-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review of The Knickerbocker</a></h3>\n\tThe Williamsburg Hotel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0f7216855cc274e40a3f35?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Williamsburg Hotel King Terrace View\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden hour from the terrace of a King Studio room.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Emily Hochberg/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.hotels.com/ho513242528/?q-check-out=2020-05-04&#38;FPQ=5&#38;q-check-in=2020-05-03&#38;WOE=1&#38;WOD=7&#38;q-room-0-children=0&#38;pa=1&#38;tab=description&#38;JHR=4&#38;q-room-0-adults=1&#38;YGF=14&#38;MGT=1&#38;ZSX=0&#38;SYE=3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Book The Williamsburg Hotel</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Boutique</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Williamsburg, Brooklyn</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices:</strong>$170/$557</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Couples, groups of friends</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Excellent restaurant, sceney rooftop bar, seasonal pool, pop-up store and programming</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Guests receive priority access to the popular rooftop water tower bar and trendy pool scene. Rooms are well-designed and the gem-toned tiled bathrooms are gorgeous</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Entry-level rooms are very small and not soundproofed from other hotel guests. Splurging on a suite is really the only way to avoid both pain points</p></aside><p>Williamsburg in Brooklyn is much like the boutique concept itself, with local artisan wares, small-batch products, and whimsical intrigue spilling out from most restaurants, bars, and storefronts. The Williamsburg Hotel curates this approach with meticulous precision and offers panoramic city views and wonderful on-site food and drink that locals love, too.</p><p>The hotel channels the neighborhood's cool factor, weaving it through guestroom offerings and products, pop-up shops in the lobby, and weekly programming that includes anything from basket weaving and flower arranging to music sets and facials. While other area hotels are overtly modern and luxe, the Williamsburg Hotel is both, but with a more intimate, laid-back vibe.&#160;</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thewilliamsburghotel.com/travel-advisory\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-williamsburg-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">Read our full hotel review for The Williamsburg Hotel</a></h3>\n\tAce Hotel New York\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db85205dee019586f1b9533?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ace Hotel New York  Hotel review\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Book Ace Hotel New York</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Budget</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> NoMad</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$175/$419</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Solo and business travelers</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Trendy restaurant, bar, cafe, co-working spaces and designer shops</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> The Ace brand cool factor, a NoMad location, and on-site stores and eateries that are so good, you might not want to leave the property</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Some rooms show wear and tear and the lobby can feel crowded</p></aside><p>Ace Hotels have long established themselves as the cool kid, operating in hip cities like Portland, Palm Springs, Seattle and more. It's the hipster, in hotel form.</p><p>The New York location has moody lighting, minimal rooms, and decor inspired by art and rock music. But it's not all hype. We'd recommend Ace to anyone who wants to feel like one of the cool local kids spread out on the lobby's leather sofas to co-work. Except unlike most of them, you'll get to actually go upstairs and spend the night. Choose a small or bunk bed room and you might even land it for well under $200 per night.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available <a href=\"https://www.acehotel.com/newyork/more/reservation-policies/covid-19-preparedness-update/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p><h3><a Boutique</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> NoMad</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices:&#160;</strong>$179/$301</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Solo travelers, couples</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Rooftop cocktail bar and two excellent restaurants</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Excellent on-site food and drink with competitive pricing for a four-star hotel</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Pricing is unstable and can surge hundreds higher than is typical otherwise</p></aside><p>Rooms at the Park South Hotel are relatively straightforward, but recent renovations have made it a highly-reviewed hotel in Manhattan's NoMad neighborhood. It belongs to World of Hyatt's Joie de Vivre boutique portfolio and has a standout culinary program that might very well upstage the tasteful rooms.</p><p>Aside from high season, it's very reasonably priced for a well-appointed four-star hotel.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures:&#160;</strong>This hotel is currently closed until April 1, 2021.</p><h3><a amenities: </strong>Gorgeous lobby bar, seasonal rooftop bar, French restaurant</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Fancy digs with a SoHo address</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Rooms prices can be expensive A basic Queen Superior starts at a very accessible price, but prices can fluctuate wildly.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a Boutique</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Bryant Park</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$189/$329</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Tourists, couples</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Impressive breakfast buffet, restaurant with bar, full gym, a nicely-furnished terrace, complimentary amenity closet</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> The low-key boutique vibe across from Bryant Park, self-serve amenities, and New York-inspired breakfast buffet</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> It's expensive in high season and standard rooms are small</p></aside><p>The Park Terrace is a great base for those who love boutique hotels and want to be near Times Square, but not actually thrust into it. Little details shine, from amenity closets available to guests on each floor to grab items you may have forgotten to pack, to the tranquil furnished terrace where you can grab a drink from the adjacent bar and linger with a view. There's also a great breakfast buffet featuring locally sourced baked goods. This hotel has personality without feeling stuffy.&#160;</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://parkterracehotel.com/park-terrace-certified-safe-and-clean-program-overview/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><h3><a Boutique</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Midtown</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$199/$399</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Tourists, families</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Restaurant and bar, library lounge for wine and cheese reception</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Perks such as happy hour, lounge access, and breakfast included in room rates</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Rooms feel dated and not as stylish as other NYC hotels</p></aside><p>The four-star&#160;Library Hotel, by Library Hotel Collection in Midtown, New York is a book lover's paradise, but there's plenty to adore even if you don't consider yourself a bibliophile.</p><p>The highly-reviewed property consistently ranks within <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=8092&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tripadvisor.com%2FHotel_Review-g60763-d224221-Reviews-Library_Hotel_by_Library_Hotel_Collection-New_York_City_New_York.html&#38;clickref=1576001274703a9bmipahs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Trip Advisor</a>'s top 10 hotels in New York City. It has a charming, whimsical vibe thanks to themed floors and over 6,000 book titles available to peruse. Rooms tend to be small, but perks such as wine and cheese receptions, 24/7 snacks and refreshments, and breakfast included add value.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures:&#160;</strong>This hotel is closed for reservations until April 2021.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/library-hotel-by-library-collection-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review of Library Hotel</a></h3>\n\tThe Beekman, a Thompson Hotel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc428aa7eece546d71f08a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Beekman levels\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jen Gushue/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biip_121919_best-new-york-hotels&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fthe-beekman-a-thompson-hotel.html%3Faid%3D898409%26label%3Daffnetawin-index_pub-257137_site-1576857160647allqy55h0_pname-Business%2BInsider_plc-_ts-_clkid-6776_1576861130_9fa3d97f9da3f964a05d9c2891cf0383%26awc%3D6776_1576861130_9fa3d97f9da3f964a05d9c2891cf0383%26utm_source%3Daffnetawin%26utm_medium%3D%26utm_term%3Dindex%26utm_content%3D257137\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Book The Beekman</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Luxury</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Financial District</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$224/$465</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Couples, business travelers, fans of historic hotels</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Multiple excellent restaurants and gathering spaces</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Incredible architecture, friendly service, great on-site food and drink</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Many previous guests have complained of noise</p></aside><p>Behind a historic, yet unassuming facade, The Beekman Hotel is a jewel hiding in plain sight. Housed in a New York City landmark building dating back to 1881, the hotel features a breathtakingly preserved nine-story atrium. We spent the night in a suite, and while lovely, your money is just as well spent in a more affordable Superior Queen, which feels equally iconic.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available <a href=\"https://www.thebeekman.com/safety-first/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-beekman-hotel-review-new-york\" src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dbca1b5e0ee7e589d0d1746?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge Dumbo King\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>There&#39;s a partition dividing the bed from the partially open bathroom.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Emily Hochberg/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biip_121919_best-new-york-hotels&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2F1-brooklyn-bridge.en-gb.html%3Faid%3D356281%3Bsid%3Daa37617f285310a3e4899f2ab43f877c%3Bdest_id%3D20085207%3Bdest_type%3Dcity%3Bdist%3D0%3Bgroup_adults%3D2%3Bgroup_children%3D0%3Bhapos%3D1%3Bhpos%3D1%3Bno_rooms%3D1%3Broom1%3DA%252CA%3Bsb_price_type%3Dtotal%3Bsr_order%3Dpopularity%3Bsrepoch%3D1576856620%3Bsrpvid%3Dc5ea6e96ae910047%3Btype%3Dtotal%3Bucfs%3D1%26%23hotelTmpl\" amenities:&#160;</strong>Well-regarded restaurant, rooftop bar, nice cafe, small gym, co-working spaces</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Cool rooms make thoughtful use of the size so the standard offerings don't feel like a compromise, plus the waterfront location and city views are incredible</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> The bathroom provides little, if any, privacy</p></aside><p>One of the best things about the rooms at 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge are the stunning floor-to-ceiling views of Manhattan and, of course, the Brooklyn Bridge. But when you close the drapes, the abundant reclaimed wood, repurposed materials, living plants, and soothing neutral colors make it feel like you've escaped to a woodsy Scandinavian cabin. It's a total respite with front door access to Brooklyn Bridge Park and is another top hotel for Brooklyn.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available </strong><a All rooms have balconies with some of the best views of New York City. While holidays and weekends can start at upwards of $500 per night, flexible travelers looking to book midweek or in winter will find deals under $350. For a special occasion, consider upgrading to a suite or Manhattan view. Come sunset, you won't regret it.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thewilliamvale.com/global-response/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-william-vale-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review of The William Vale</a></h3>\n\tThe Conrad New York Downtown\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d94e7ee51823d0cb11fc2f1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Conrad New York\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The bed in the aptly named Hudson River View King Suite was incredibly plush and comfy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Emily Hochberg/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=41650&#38;u1=biip_121919_best-new-york-hotels&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hilton.com%2Fen%2Fhotels%2Fnyccici-conrad-new-york-downtown%2F%3FSEO_id%3DGMB-CI-NYCCICI\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Book Conrad New York Downtown</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Luxury</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> TriBeCa</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$260/$504</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Business travelers, families, couples, Hilton loyalists</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Restaurant, small but nice rooftop bar, gym</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> All-suite rooms offer more than double the space of typical NYC hotel rooms for similar pricing.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Not everyone will love being in TriBeCa, which can feel far from uptown neighborhoods and attractions</p></aside><p>Many visitors fixate on Midtown, but the Conrad New York Downtown offers a more local experience in a neighborhood where real New Yorkers actually spend time.</p><p>An all-suite offering, you'll be hard-pressed to find more spacious accommodations in all of downtown Manhattan. traditional decor, and suites are apartment-style with terraces and marble bathrooms. loyalists</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Good lobby restaurant, huge gym&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> All rooms are spacious, offering great value for families or those on a longer youthful, with a design-heavy approach favoring rich gem-tone velvet upholstery, modern light fixtures, and prominent art.</p><p>Like its downtown sibling, all rooms are suites with standard entry-level offerings that feel more pied-a-terre than a generic hotel room. review of Conrad New York Midtown</a></h3>\n\tThe Chatwal\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db1b0acdee01904ef3cdd62?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Chatwal Hotel bed\" height=\"900\" Broadway concierge is excellent and will make you feel like Upper East Side royalty</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Room prices are expensive and might be out of reach for many</p></aside><p>The Chatwal is another higher-end property we've deemed worth the cost given its coveted Midtown location, old school Manhattan glam, five-star service, and sizeable rooms.</p><p>Rooms start at $500 per night, which isn't cheap but is accurately priced for such a top-tier hotel in Manhattan. It's actually cheaper than other ritzier counterparts. As a Marriott Bonvoy property, it's a good place to cash in on points if the price tag still seems out of reach, too.&#160;</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures:&#160;</strong>The Chatwal is not currently open and has not stated when they will be reopening.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-chatwal-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review of The Chatwal</a></h3>\n\tBaccarat Hotel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e6f8f9ec485402f5115b092?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Baccarat Hotel\" height=\"975\" width=\"1300\" href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fbaccarat-and-residences-new-york.html%3Faid%3D356281%3Blabel%3Dmetatripad-link-dmetaus-hotel-1294230_xqdz-a185ae7a35ff671c53d3b8893fbc5369_los-01_bw-048_dom-com_curr-USD_gst-01_nrm-01_clkid-Xm%2540OyAokGzcAATrUB7cAAAEd_aud-0000_mbl-L_pd-B_sc-2_defdate-0_spo-0_clksrc-0%3Bsid%3Daa37617f285310a3e4899f2ab43f877c%3Ball_sr_blocks%3D129423007_197210531_0_0_0%3Bcheckin%3D2020-05-03%3Bcheckout%3D2020-05-04%3Bdest_id%3D20088325%3Bdest_type%3Dcity%3Bdist%3D0%3Bgroup_adults%3D1%3Bgroup_children%3D0%3Bhapos%3D1%3Bhighlighted_blocks%3D129423007_197210531_0_0_0%3Bhpos%3D1%3Bno_rooms%3D1%3Breq_adults%3D1%3Breq_children%3D0%3Broom1%3DA%3Bsb_price_type%3Dtotal%3Bsr_order%3Dpopularity%3Bsr_pri_blocks%3D129423007_197210531_0_0_0__109500%3Bsrepoch%3D1584369356%3Bsrpvid%3D312766a50609013c%3Btype%3Dtotal%3Bucfs%3D1%26%23hotelTmpl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Book Baccarat Hotel</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Luxury</p><p><strong>Neighborhood:</strong> Midtown</p><p><strong>Starting/peak prices: </strong>$675/$1,407</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Business travelers, couples</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Glamorous restaurant and bar, beautiful indoor pool, spa, gym&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> The overall design of the entire hotel is immaculate, elegant, and refined, while still remaining warm and welcoming. On-site food served in the Salon is not to be missed</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> The entry-level price is very expensive for a standard room. Additionally, even the purported best hotel in New York isn't perfect &#8212; the noise from the TV in the next room was quite audible during my stay</p></aside><p>Baccarat Hotel is regarded as one of the best hotels in New York City, if not the world, and it's easy to see why. The elegant property, owned by the French fine crystal brand of the same name, is teeming with dazzling crystal fixtures, glassware, and chandeliers from the high-end line, which are found everywhere from common areas, guest rooms, and even elevators.</p><p>The opulent look also delivers on substance as well as style, with impeccable service, painstaking attention to detail, and gleaming rooms that feel like the kind of place James Bond might stay (truly, there are even doors fashioned out of wall panels).</p><p><strong>COVID-19 procedures are available</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.baccarathotels.com/covid-19\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/baccarat-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">Read our full review of Baccarat Hotel</a></h3>\n\tOur methodology for selecting hotels\n\t\n\t<p>Much of travel is, in truth, subjective. One person might love city hotels and another will loathe the noise and crowds. Similarly, one traveler might simply seek a place to rest their head and another will want to be dazzled and delighted by luxury at every turn. Others have kids to entertain, business to tend to, and an itinerary to work around. Of course, all of these people do have in common: they all set a budget, whether it's looking for a cheap hotel or five-star luxury at an expected price.</p><p>For these reasons, this list of hotels offers a mix of all of these factors including:</p><p><strong>Price</strong>: We chose budget, mid-range, and luxury hotels in New York City ranging from bare-bones bunk rooms to standard hotel rooms and indulgent suites. We only accepted starting room rates in low season under $800 per night.</p><p><strong>Value</strong>: Price is one thing, but value is another. We chose hotels in New York City that offered strong value for the money such as large rooms, great views, good on-site amenities, excellent service, central locations, and more.</p><p><strong>Location</strong>: The best hotels in New York City represent a wide range of neighborhoods across Manhattan from the Upper East Side to TriBeCa and the Financial District in lower Manhattan. We also reviewed hotels in Brooklyn.</p><p><strong>Guests</strong>: We always think, \"who stays here?\" when reviewing hotels and chose the best hotels in New York City for families, couples, solo travelers, business travelers, groups of friends, and more so you can pick the best base for your particular trip.</p><p><strong>Reviews</strong>: We read and consulted past guest reviews and ratings on sites such as Trip Advisor, Hotels.com, Booking.com, and others to ensure that the majority of past guest experiences were overwhelmingly positive.</p><p><strong>Experience</strong>: We also visited and personally stayed at every hotel on this list. Included hotels were chosen based on first-hand experience considering every factor on this list rather than solely researching what others have said. We then visited to back up those claims.</p><p><strong>Cleanliness</strong>: Travel won't be the same post-pandemic for quite some time, so we only selected hotels that prioritize the health and safety of their guests either by imposing strict new cleaning policies in light of COVID-19 or temporarily closing until they can safely address all concerns.</p>\n\tMore of the best hotels in New York City\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6036aff7bed5c50011a2c521?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the high line hotel new york\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Booking.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>These aren't the only hotels we've reviewed in New York City. We stayed at many others, too,&#160; included in the lists below for the best luxury, boutique, or affordable hotels in New York City.&#160;</p><p>Additionally, we've reviewed other New York City hotels that we liked, but didn't deem worthy of a spot on this list, at this time.</p><p>And,&#160;we are in the process of reviewing and considering other New York City hotels and will regularly update this list based on those stays.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-luxury-hotels-new-york-city\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best luxury hotels in New York City</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-boutique-hotels-new-york-city\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best boutique hotels in New York City</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-affordable-hotels-new-york-city\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best affordable hotels in New York City</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/insider-picks-nyc-hotels\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">All our New York City hotel reviews</a></li></ul>\n\tFAQs: Everything you should know about booking a New York City hotel\n\t\n\t<p><strong>What is the best time of year to visit New York City?</strong></p><p>This answer is dependent on what you intend to do. If you're planning on doing lots of sightseeing, consider visiting in the spring or fall when the temperatures are mild and it's comfortable to explore the city without worrying about extreme weather.</p><p>However, some people think visiting New York around the holidays is a magical time, and others like the summer when the city feels less crowded.</p><p><strong>What are the best neighborhoods to stay in when visiting New York City?</strong></p><p>If you're a first-time visitor who wants to see the lights of Broadway and stay in the center of the action, you're probably looking at Times Square. However, to feel more of a local, neighborhood vibe, consider staying in atmospheric neighborhoods such as Chelsea, Flatiron, NoMad, or adjacent areas of Midtown such as Bryant Park to experience fewer crowds.</p><p>If you've been to New York before, or are open to other areas, we recommend heading downtown to TriBeCa or across the bridge to Williamsburg or DUMBO in Brooklyn, all of which have great hotels (featured on this list).</p><p><strong>What are the cheapest times of year to visit? The most expensive?</strong></p><p>You'll often find the cheapest hotel prices in New York in the winter, right after the holidays and until early spring. Prices may dip again in late summer when high heat and humidity keep crowds low.</p><p>Expect prices to surge the highest from early September through the end of the year, when events such as New York Fashion Week and the holiday season pack in visitors and tourists consistently, year after year. During those times, even the cheapest budget hotels will see their base starting rates at least double in price.</p><p><strong>Is it safe to stay in hotels right now?</strong></p><p>With vaccine rollouts underway, many travelers are now looking to book postponed trips. And while <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-vacation-rentals-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">vacation rentals</a> continue to be very popular, hotels are open during COVID-19 and poised to make a big comeback as more people become fully vaccinated.&#160;</p><p>However, in hotels, you're more likely to encounter other people in common spaces such as lobbies, check-in desks, and on-site venues including pools, spas, restaurants, and bars. Thankfully, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-hotels-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">experts we spoke to said that with added caution, it is safe to stay in a hotel</a>.&#160;</p><p>Of course, there's no guarantee of safety when it comes to travel. We recommend following CDC guidelines and wearing a mask in public, using hand sanitizer, and following social distancing.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a fd9db26bd100b813?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-55-145_8b4807f997b75bcd.webp","https://i.insider.com/5df16b64fd9db25f9b60e8f2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn58@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-53-703_ea2f692201dfe833.webp","https://i.insider.com/5da612764af90906f21d1d02?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn55@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-58-963_1739c690acd7388b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dd2d48d3afd375084607ef4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn100@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-59-328_b73655739f2ffee6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc428aa7eece546d71f08a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn8@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-42-906_19ec8db3e5ebad93.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dbca1b5e0ee7e589d0d1746?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn88@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-48-499_54518b4839113b7c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db0c675dee0191b202e0275?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn2@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-54-014_bdd6ca83842c999d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d94e7ee51823d0cb11fc2f1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn61@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-53-823_6e30b1ed26c2303c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5df1617bfd9db23c642fadc2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn72@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-54-884_85b4a47e5f1235cf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e1f81a8b6d52d1f9707b7b4?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5df91cd6fd9db21260493bc5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn87@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-47-716_92163b677e33bd6a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db1b0acdee01904ef3cdd62?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn22@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-54-149_6611a7702d7e5b8a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e6f8f9ec485402f5115b092?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn59@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-54-666_7681a6d4224b6658.webp","https://i.insider.com/6036aff7bed5c50011a2c521?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn16@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-57-607_de799a782b4590b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xX7M6NCZBxQ:AfCo97nvdZI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn1@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-56-796_7d982f2e97e8678e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xX7M6NCZBxQ:AfCo97nvdZI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn36@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-41-948_64380cc74bc47815.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xX7M6NCZBxQ:AfCo97nvdZI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn62@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-643_629d937d2d3fdd65.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/xX7M6NCZBxQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn89@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-56-670_08c6cc43e2045a9a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425374148},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Vermont is putting BIPOC people at the front of the vaccination line. Here's why it's a great idea.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/vermont-vaccines-bipoc-people-front-line-opinion-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/605ce79a106eb50019d05a9e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"covid vaccines us.JPG\" height=\"1467\" width=\"1956\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A medical worker prepares to administer a COVID-19 vaccine.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters/Octavio Jones</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Right now, a 30-year-old BIPOC Vermonter can get vaccinated, but a 30-year-old white Vermonter cannot.</li>\n<li>This is just good public health policy in action, argues healthcare network director Jessica Frisco.</li>\n<li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Vermont Governor Phil Scott <a href=\"https://www.healthvermont.gov/covid-19/vaccine/getting-covid-19-vaccine\">recently announced</a> that Black people, Indigenous people, and all people of color over the age of 16 and their households can now get vaccinated for COVID-19. As of Tuesday, non-BIPOC Vermonters have to be 50 or older to get the vaccine. </p><p>Basically, a 30-year-old BIPOC Vermonter can get vaccinated right now, but a 30-year-old white Vermonter cannot. </p><p>The move has launched <a href=\"https://twitter.com/wesyang/status/1377824962711584772?s=20\">something of a moral panic among pundits</a>, but a quick look at Vermont&#39;s unique demographics and some basic understanding of public health explain why it&#39;s actually a great idea.</p><p>Vaccine distribution plans, in Vermont and across the country, have prioritized the most vulnerable populations from the start. A quick look at the numbers reveals that giving early vaccine access to Vermont&#39;s BIPOC population simply continues that strategy. </p><h2><strong>Vermont&#39;s unique demographics</strong></h2><p>Vermont is the second-least populated state in the country. It&#39;s also the whitest. With a population of only <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/VT\">630,000 people, 94% of whom are white</a>, there are only about 36,000 BIPOC people in Vermont. New York City has over 4 million BIPOC individuals, about half its population. The US. in total is 76% white, so Vermont is demographically very unique in that sense. </p><p>Not only is the BIPOC population of Vermont small in absolute terms and in proportion to the white population, it&#39;s also at higher risk. Vermont&#39;s BIPOC live mostly in denser populated areas with the <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/burlingtoncityvermont\">highest concentration in Burlington, Vermont&#39;s biggest and hardest hit city</a>. </p><h2><strong>Why vaccinating Vermont&#39;s BIPOC population makes sense</strong></h2><p>Nationally, BIPOC populations are <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/black-workers-essential-coronavirus-c502fc2e-a4fc-4c4f-ae0c-722a50d74ecd.html\">more likely to hold jobs as essential workers</a> or in roles that increase their exposure to COVID-19. By far, Burlington has more cases than the rest of Vermont, and it&#39;s known that Black Vermonters alone have the <a href=\"https://www.healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/documents/pdf/COVID19-Weekly-Data-Summary-3-26-2021.pdf\">highest rates of COVID in the state</a>.<em> </em></p><p>Also, BIPOC populations consistently prove harder to reach with public health initiatives. These groups are less likely to have a <a href=\"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4899337/\">primary care doctor who they feel comfortable calling up for an appointment</a>. They face more significant <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2015/08/the-transportation-barrier/399728/\">transportation difficulties</a> in getting to an appointment. And their <a href=\"https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5f85f5a156091e113f96e4d3/t/5fb72481b1eb2e6cf845457f/1605837977495/VaccineHesitancy_BlackLatinx_Final_11.19.pdf\">initial hesitancy</a> about the vaccine has been well-documented (though enthusiasm across racial and ethnic backgrounds <a href=\"https://www.kff.org/coronavirus-covid-19/dashboard/kff-covid-19-vaccine-monitor-dashboard/?gclid=CjwKCAjwgZuDBhBTEiwAXNofRIfHNKxrcur9yoE50yuI8rc-ptKJOVb5kqObLhzvTD-_PfmQlvxx3xoCkgsQAvD_BwE\">continues to grow</a> overall, as availability becomes more widespread).</p><p>This all bears out on the numbers we&#39;re seeing for Vermont vaccination rates, with only <a href=\"https://www.mynbc5.com/article/vermont-focusing-vaccine-efforts-on-bipoc-population/35787178\">22%</a> of BIPOC Vermonters vaccinated, versus <a href=\"https://www.vpr.org/post/news-roundup-starting-thursday-all-bipoc-vermonters-are-eligible-vaccines#stream/0\">35% of the broader population</a>.  </p><p>Creating more opportunities for BIPOC people to get vaccinated will only help to protect these groups from their heightened risk from COVID-19. <em> </em></p><p><em><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606789a8a7d803001963e9a7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"282\" width=\"377\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jessica Frisco.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></em></p><h2><strong>It&#39;s not even that big of a deal</strong></h2><p>For white Vermonters under 50 years of age, the situation isn&#39;t that dire. Starting April 5, all Vermonters 40 and older can get vaccinated. On April 12, all Vermonters age 30 and older get their turn. On April 19, all Vermonters aged 16 and up can get vaccinated.</p><p>Stripped of all the racial commentary, all Vermont has done is allow a small, at-risk population to get vaccinated a few weeks ahead of other healthy, younger people. In Vermont, where <a href=\"https://twitter.com/GovPhilScott/status/1375492502430613506?s=20\">90% of COVID-19 deaths have been people over 65</a>, and <a href=\"https://twitter.com/bhrenton/status/1378004493267255311?s=20\">87.8% of that population is now vaccinated</a>, it&#39;s not as though truly vulnerable populations have been sidelined to allow minorities access to vaccinations. </p><p>Really, it&#39;s just good public health policy in action.</p><p><em>Jessica Frisco is a director at an NYC-based healthcare network. She is a registered nurse and holds a Master of Public Health degree from Columbia University.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/vermont-vaccines-bipoc-people-front-line-opinion-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=E8MpeRPspRo:pMtIB24Mq7I:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=E8MpeRPspRo:pMtIB24Mq7I:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"
