2021 21:17:26 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/605ce79a106eb50019d05a9e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6845374bf05ca59399268bdbb73c7aeb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-34-981_9a8c61d325057827.webp","destWidth":1956,"destHeight":1467,"sourceBytes":67638,"destBytes":67638,"author":"insider@insider.com (Jessica Frisco)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/605ce79a106eb50019d05a9e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-34-981_9a8c61d325057827.webp","https://i.insider.com/606789a8a7d803001963e9a7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn72@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-46-143_334249a699dc8966.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=E8MpeRPspRo:pMtIB24Mq7I:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn57@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-57-077_9b40bc4377cdbbf8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=E8MpeRPspRo:pMtIB24Mq7I:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn78@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-53-800_161a2d07e5c681f6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=E8MpeRPspRo:pMtIB24Mq7I:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-44-683_c8b7a21d3f15f931.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/E8MpeRPspRo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn42@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-53-492_61ba0afa2833a728.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373824},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Biden says his new infrastructure plan could create 19 million new jobs","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-says-new-infrastructure-plan-create-19-million-new-jobs-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606788da856cd700198a303f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"joe biden amtrak\" height=\"3560\" width=\"4746\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Andrew Harnik</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Joe Biden said Friday that his new infrastructure package could create 19 million jobs.</li>\n<li>He was citing a Moody&#39;s report that projected 16.3 million jobs from natural job growth and the $1.9 trillion stimulus.</li>\n<li>He also commented on March&#39;s jobs report, a strong sign of recovery, but still with far to go.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Joe Biden said Friday that his new American Jobs Plan - <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-2-trillion-infrastructure-plan-roads-bridges-broadband-power-2021-3\">the first of a two-part package</a> - could lead to the creation of 19 million new jobs.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/biden-says-infrastructure-plan-will-create-19-million-new-jobs?sref=BLKWHazc\">Bloomberg</a>, Biden seemed to be citing a recent Moody&#39;s Analytics report that projects 19 million jobs could be added over the next decade <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/issues-that-could-tank-bidens-infrastructure-plan-congress-salt-taxes-2021-4\">if the infrastructure plan passes</a>; however, it also estimates that 16.3 million jobs would be added over the next decade from a combination of organic job growth jobs and the already-passed American Rescue Plan.</p><p>In his Friday remarks, Biden also said that almost 90% of the infrastructure jobs could be filled by people without a college degree.</p><p>A <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/educated-americans-more-optimistic-about-economy-morning-consult-2021-3\">March analysis</a> from Morning Consult found that, during the coronavirus pandemic, more educated Americans saw their confidence rebound and grow. The same could not be said for lower-wage, less-educated workers, who feared for their ability to hold onto a job. Higher-educated Americans felt confident enough to ask for pay increases, the analysis showed.</p><p>Biden&#39;s remarks were tied to Friday&#39;s jobs report, which saw the economy add <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/march-jobs-report-916000-payrolls-unemployment-rate-economic-recovery-infrastructure-2021-4\">916,000 jobs</a>, far outpacing economists&#39; expectations of 660,000.</p><p>While different unemployment measures dropped amidst the good jobs news, the country still has a long way to go before returning to pre-pandemic levels. In a <a href=\"https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/blog/2021/04/02/the-employment-situation-in-march/\">blog post</a>, Cecilia Rouse, the chair of the Council of Economic Advisers, said there were still 8.4 million fewer jobs in March 2021 than in February 2020.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/when-employment-could-get-back-to-pre-pandemic-levels-2021-4\">Insider&#39;s Andy Kiersz</a> wrote that, if the March growth rate continues, employment could reach pre-pandemic levels by January 2022. Areas like movie theaters and hotels still have a long way to go, as they <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/employment-changes-from-before-pandemic-industries-2021-4\">continue to lag in recovery</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-says-new-infrastructure-plan-create-19-million-new-jobs-2021-4'>Business 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Ether jumps to all-time high above $2,000, in step with bitcoin's latest rally","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ether-price-all-time-high-2000-bitcoin-rally-eth-btc-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675b21856cd700198a2ed7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 02 19T000000Z_1488177917_RC2YVL93EI8S_RTRMADP_3_CRYPTO CURRENCY ETHEREUM.JPG\" height=\"2843\" width=\"5686\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The cryptocurrency ether runs on the Ethereum network.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dado Ruvic/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>The price of ether surged to an all-time high Friday in lockstep with bitcoin&#39;s rally to just shy of $60,000.</strong></li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>&#34;The main takeaway for me is that the increased capital flows into crypto is now making its way into more than just [bitcoin],&#34;  Jeffrey Wang of Amber Group told Insider. </strong></li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Sergey Nazarov, co-founder of Chainlink, also attributed the surge in ether to the rise of decentralized finance, or DeFi.</strong></li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/10-things-opening-bell\">Sign up here for our daily newsletter, 10 Things Before the Opening Bell</a></strong></li>\n</ul><p>The price of ether, the world&#39;s second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, surged to an all-time high Friday in lockstep with the rally in the price of bitcoin.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/eth-usd\">Ether</a> climbed to a high of $2,077 at around 11 a.m. ET. It first broke the $2,000 threshold around 9:50 am ET Friday. The digital asset for the ethereum network has gained 177% in 2021 alone and 1,370% in the past 12 months. </p><p>&#34;It&#39;s very positive to see [ether] rally along with [bitcoin] which has been the de facto flag bearer for crypto assets,&#34; Jeffrey Wang, Head of America&#39;s at Amber Group, told Insider. &#34;The main takeaway for me is that the increased capital flows into crypto is now making its way into more than just [bitcoin].&#34;</p><p>Wang also said investor diversification bodes well for the whole cryptocurrency space, which has seen a broader rally in recent weeks, boosted by the economic recovery from the pandemic-led recession and the third round of stimulus checks under the Biden administration.</p><p>Bitcoin this week has <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-price-today-60000-renewed-institutional-backing-paypal-visa-cme-2021-3-1030265701\">flirted with the $60,000-level</a> on renewed institutional backing from PayPal, Visa, and CME Group.</p><p>&#34;[Bitcoin] is a benchmark for investors&#39; confidence in store of value, while interest in assets like [ether] that focus on the programmable, smart contract side of the ecosystem show investors optimism for the utility and potential of decentralized finance,&#34; John Wu, President at Ava Labs, the team behind Avalanche, told Insider. &#34;Ethereum breaking past this threshold may result in a paradigm shift that will benefit the two to three smart contract networks gaining real traction with decentralized finance.&#34;</p><p>Sergey Nazarov, co-founder of Chainlink lab,a decentralized oracle network, also attributed ether&#39;s rally to the rise of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-invest-defi-bitcoin-crypto-cio-launches-new-fund-2021-2\">decentralized finance</a>, or DeFi, an umbrella term for various applications that use public blockchains and crypto assets to disrupt the traditional financial sectors. </p><p>&#34;Ethereum users are now relying on DeFi applications in order to lend, borrow, earn yield, create derivatives, options, and even trade, all without the reliance of any centralized third party like a bank or a fintech like Robinhood,&#34; Nazarov told Insider, adding that this new sector, worth <a href=\"https://links95.mixmaxusercontent.com/5fd3b03bf27084fd8d95e504/l/OWC6XNg51S7F4ZMYY?messageId=!!!MESSAGE_ID!!!&rn=!!!RECIPIENT_NAME_ENC!!!&re=!!!EMAIL_ADDR_ENC!!!&sc=!!!IS_SENDER_COPY!!!NDER_COPY!!!\">over $45 billion</a>, is the fastest growing in the cryptocurrency industry. </p><p>&#34;I would expect to see more users utilize DeFi on Ethereum as they hunt for yield that ranges in the double digits,&#34; Nazarov said. &#34;I wouldn&#39;t be surprised if the total value locked into DeFi apps on ethereum surges past hundreds of billions of dollars.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read Lee)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60675b21856cd700198a2ed7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn8@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-48-731_6798df1e97e881e7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=39A0aoUVAW8:g4sXG9ShO8k:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn87@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-57-464_4f8098a5a52d8fef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=39A0aoUVAW8:g4sXG9ShO8k:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn79@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-45-075_f337aeac507fd9ae.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=39A0aoUVAW8:g4sXG9ShO8k:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn37@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-14-089_050aa71d54740ea9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/39A0aoUVAW8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn35@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-52-778_67864928581e1da6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373752},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"China reportedly told H&M to 'bolster its awareness of the national territory' after citing issues with the retailer's 'problematic' maps","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-hm-problematic-maps-boycott-forced-labor-accusations-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60676794a7d803001963e8ae?format=jpeg\" alt=\"china h&#38;m\" height=\"1266\" width=\"1688\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A woman walks by an H&#38;M clothing store at a shopping area on March 30, 2021 in Beijing, China.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kevin Frayer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>China told H&#38;M to correct what it says is inaccurate mapping on the retailer&#39;s website.</li>\n<li>H&#38;M has before been criticized by China for listing Hong Kong as a country.</li>\n<li>Many in China have boycotted H&#38;M recently over year-old comments about accusations of forced labor in the country.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Chinese officials told H&#38;M to fix its mapping system on its website and to &#34;bolster its awareness of national territory,&#34; per a Friday report from the <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/h-m-summoned-by-chinese-authorities-over-mapping-issue-11617379944?mod=e2tw\">Wall Street Journal</a>.</p><p>Regulators reportedly took issue with what some online Chinese users called &#34;problematic Chinese maps&#34; on H&#38;M&#39;s website.</p><p>The country&#39;s internet regulator said that H&#38;M has taken steps to correct the map inaccuracies, according to the report. H&#38;M was directed by the regulator to study Chinese laws and &#34;really ensure the standardized use of the Chinese map,&#34; the Journal reports. </p><p>H&#38;M declined Insider&#39;s request for comment.</p><p>The retailer has drawn criticism from China in the past for labeling Hong Kong, Macau, and Tibet as countries, as well as labeling Taiwan as a country on the retailer&#39;s native Taiwan website, the Journal notes.</p><p>The government in Beijing considers Taiwan a province of China, not a country on its own, and has increased its military as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/chinas-military-buildup-attitude-toward-taiwan-raises-conflict-fears-2020-9\">its attitude toward Taiwan has grown increasingly harsh</a>. </p><p>The Swedish retailer became enthralled in controversy following the resurfacing of <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/hm-chinese-e-commerce-boycott-social-media-firestorm-2021-3\">months-old comments about &#34;forced labor&#34;</a> of Uighur Muslims in the Xinjiang region.</p><p>Reports have found the Uighur minority community to be under persecution, through concentration camps and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-forcibly-sterilizing-uighur-women-xinjiang-abortions-contraception-ap-2020-6\">forced sterilization</a>. China has maintained its position that the camps are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-forcibly-sterilizing-uighur-women-xinjiang-abortions-contraception-ap-2020-6\">&#34;reeducation centers&#34;</a> designed to quell religious extremism and terrorist threats, not facilities designed to extinguish Uighur culture.</p><p>The comments were recirculated online last week after some governments, including the US, imposed sanctions on Chinese officials over allegations of human-rights violations. H&#38;M&#39;s criticism of forced labor in the country drew ire from Chinese consumers and companies, who boycotted the brand. Shortly after, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hm-boycott-wiped-from-internet-china-2021-3\">H&#38;M appeared to be scrubbed from the internet in China</a>, with products missing from popular shopping sites and the location of H&#38;M&#39;s 500 stores removed from map services.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hm-china-internet-boycott-uyghurs-2021-3\">H&#38;M has since responded to the backlash</a>, saying it is &#34;dedicated to regaining the trust and confidence of our customers, colleagues, and business partners in China.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/china-hm-problematic-maps-boycott-forced-labor-accusations-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/qO-lwvSGuXU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 19:37:38 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60676794a7d803001963e8ae?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"49d0f28f88860cc43691714f43c6c952","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn59@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-34-772_2e7033720876513c.webp","destWidth":1688,"destHeight":1266,"sourceBytes":123430,"destBytes":123430,"author":"insider@insider.com (Katie Canales)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60676794a7d803001963e8ae?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn59@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-34-772_2e7033720876513c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn31@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-47-974_19dbbb04137d0c1a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn7@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-59-637_b7973cb3a192a5c4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qO-lwvSGuXU:HlWNpY_59_k:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn95@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-47-615_aa9d8fda6cb0287b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/qO-lwvSGuXU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn12@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-47-781_6dfeaf0dffd3a4b6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373873},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Why food tastes different on planes","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/airplane-food-tastes-different-explained-2020-1","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/rq2oqFhR-jZbcmOYf.html\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"Why food tastes different on planes\" style=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Not many people are fans of airline food, but as it turns out, you don&#39;t taste food in the air the same way you do on the ground. </li>\n<li>Several factors on the plane - including the background noise, pressurized cabin, and dry air - all suppress your ability to taste sweet and salty food by at least 30%.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/emirates-airline-airplane-food-how-makes-flight-meals-2019-5\">Airline caterers</a> often modify their recipes to accommodate for the loss in taste. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em>Following is a transcript of the video.</em> </p><p><strong>Narrator: </strong>Ever look at the beverage cart on a plane and see it piled high with tomato juice? It&#39;s not a common juice, like orange or apple. So why are so many people drinking it in flight? Put simply? Your taste changes while you&#39;re in the air. And there&#39;s a biological reason for that.</p><p>If you grab a bite before your flight, you probably have an idea of what it will taste like. But once you&#39;re in the air, your sense of taste isn&#39;t the same as it is on the ground. A lot of factors on the plane are all coming together to suppress your sense of smell, which makes up a large portion of our sense of taste.</p><p>Think back to the last time you had a cold. Remember how you couldn&#39;t taste anything because your nose was clogged up? When you have a weakened sense of smell, your perception of taste is reduced. So your in-flight nose is similar to your nose when you have a cold, but hopefully with less phlegm.</p><p>Let&#39;s start with the cabin, which is extremely dry. Drier-than-some-deserts dry. The dry cabin dries out your nasal passages, which means your taste buds become less perceptive. But that&#39;s not the only part of the cabin suppressing your sense of taste. The low cabin pressure actually decreases the levels of oxygen in your blood, which means your olfactory receptors, the part of your nervous system that responds to smells, become less sensitive, which actually weakens your sense of smell.</p><p>But it&#39;s not just the environment inside the cabin that&#39;s affecting your senses. The noise coming from the engine isn&#39;t helping either. A 2010 study tested people&#39;s sense of taste both inside and outside a simulated plane cabin. The researchers found sensitivity to sweet and salty food was reduced by 30% while in the cabin.</p><p>And that weakened sense of taste can cause a lot of problems for airline caterers, who have to modify every recipe to account for it. To top it off, not every flavor is affected equally. Some ingredients, like curry and lemongrass, actually become more intense in the sky, while cinnamon, ginger, and garlic tend to maintain their taste. Some airlines will use naturally intense flavors, like certain fruit and vegetable oils and concentrates, which helps to lessen the amount of extra salt a recipe might need.</p><p>So, what does tomato juice have to do with all of this? Well, tomato juice tends to have a savory flavor referred to as umami. It&#39;s one of the five categories of taste, along with sweet, sour, salt, and bitter. A 2015 study found that, with umami, the taste phenomenon is actually reversed. Umami is actually enhanced in the air.</p><p>So the next time you&#39;re on a flight, give the tomato juice a try. And don&#39;t get too upset if your meal doesn&#39;t taste as good as you hoped. The chefs are just trying to accommodate for something you didn&#39;t know was happening right underneath your nose.</p><p><em>EDITOR&#39;S NOTE: This video was originally published in January 2020.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/airplane-food-tastes-different-explained-2020-1'>Business Insider</a></div><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/AC2OVYBLSV4\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 18:26:06 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5e0e205f855cc26184340d64?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"ffa4801c0e522b29c0e3abb12c0081de","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn15@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-50-903_951b99ab37f06232.webp","destWidth":2200,"destHeight":1650,"sourceBytes":266036,"destBytes":266036,"author":"jtungul@businessinsider.com (Jade Tungul)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn75@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-48-463_8e7589eab61d7529.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn20@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-46-434_74d929aba4213633.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AC2OVYBLSV4:aXhLKH02mlo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn96@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-57-470_c4ed974bf4a486ac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/AC2OVYBLSV4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn32@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-58-645_e1e1d693eab83ae8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373931},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Discovery Plus is the perfect streaming service for fans of nonfiction shows, but its interface needs some work","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/discovery-plus-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>If you buy through our links, we may earn money from affiliate partners. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60673a9a856cd700198a2e0f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Discovery Plus Review wide\" height=\"1418\" width=\"2837\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Discovery Plus/Ben Blanchet/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> offers all your favorite Discovery, TLC, Animal Planet, Food Network, and HGTV shows.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">The service costs $5 a month with ads, or $7 a month without commercials.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">The interface has flaws, but the low price makes it a great option for fans of Discovery&#39;s networks.</li>\n</ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"6013317088948700119fd9cc\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Free Trial for Verizon Unlimited Customers (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"60550ef41870630011aa2b27\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Monthly Plan (ad-supported) (small)</bi-shortcode><p><a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> is one of the latest services to throw its hat into the streaming wars. </p><p>The platform launched in the US on January 4 and is the streaming home for programs from Discovery Channel, TLC, Animal Planet, Investigation Discovery, Travel Channel, HGTV, and Food Network. It also features dozens of new Discovery Plus Originals and handy 24/7 streaming channels for popular shows.</p><p>Discovery Plus plans are priced at $5 a month with ads or $7 a month for commercial-free streaming. <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.verizon.com%2Fsolutions-and-services%2Fdiscovery-plus%2F-plus%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Select Verizon customers can even get a full year for free</a>.</p><p>I signed up for the ad-supported plan and tried the service for about a week to see how it performs. While browsing through the Discovery Plus library, it&#39;s been exciting to circle back to classic shows and discover brand-new series, but the interface could still use some work.</p><h2>Price, plans, and deals</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> costs $5 a month for ad-supported viewing, or $7 a month for commercial-free streaming. Each plan comes with a free seven-day trial. </p><p>Verizon is also giving select customers up to <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.verizon.com%2Fsolutions-and-services%2Fdiscovery-plus%2F-plus%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">12 months of Discovery Plus for free.</a> The promotion is for the ad-free plan and is available to new Fios customers, new 5G internet customers, and all unlimited phone plan customers.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"6013317088948700119fd9cc\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Free Trial for Verizon Unlimited Customers (small)</bi-shortcode><p>Unlike some other services, Discovery Plus only offers monthly plans, so there&#39;s no discount if you pay for a full year up front. The service does offer <a href=\"https://gift.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">gift cards</a>, however, for 12 months ($83.75) or six months ($41.75) of its ad-free plan. </p><h2>Content library</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60673c56a7d803001963e76e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Discovery Plus Review titles\" height=\"1304\" width=\"1739\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Discovery Plus/Ben Blanchet/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> understands its lane, offering a big library of shows designed to cater to fans of reality TV, nature programs, cooking, true crime, and education. People who like scripted dramas and comedies, however, will have to look elsewhere. Discovery Plus is purely a service for fans of Discovery networks, and in that sense, its catalog offers a lot of value. </p><p>With classic titles pulled from all of Discovery&#39;s brands and networks, the service is jam-packed with blasts from the past, including &#34;Dirty Jobs,&#34; &#34;The Crocodile Hunter,&#34; &#34;Mythbusters,&#34; and &#34;Unwrapped.&#34; There are also dozens of new Discovery Plus Originals, like &#34;Cocktails and Tall Tales,&#34; &#34;Luda Can&#39;t Cook,&#34; and &#34;Monster Garage.&#34; </p><p>The original shows, in particular, have creative concepts - like rapper Ludacris learning how to cook different dishes. As a whole, the entire lineup features a solid selection of quality shows centered around the home, food, and history.</p><p>By our count, we found 91 programs listed as &#34;Discovery Plus Originals&#34; either with full episodes or trailers indicating they are coming soon. Not every original program was under the Discovery Plus Originals category, however, as we found at least 12 under the platform&#39;s tab for the upcoming Magnolia Network (rebrand of DIY Network).</p><h2>Interface</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60676e09a7d803001963e8e3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Discovery Plus Review show page\" height=\"1427\" width=\"2855\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Discovery Plus/Ben Blanchet/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> interface works well enough but it doesn&#39;t have any standout characteristics and it can feel bulky and hard to navigate. It&#39;s particularly confusing to find the platform&#39;s 24/7 streaming channels, as they aren&#39;t on the sidebar or top menu like you&#39;d expect.</p><p>The platform&#39;s sidebar contains the basics for exploring the catalog, including a tab for browsing shows, a tab for saved programs (&#34;My List&#34;), and a search bar. The &#34;Browse&#34; tab allows you to find content by its original channel and also by category such as &#34;True Crime&#34; and &#34;Lifestyle.&#34; </p><p>To get to the 24/7 channels, you need to scroll down a bit on the &#34;For You&#34; page. This is also where you&#39;ll find rows for the platform&#39;s themed collections. The 24/7 channels are a terrific inclusion for binge-watchers as they let you stream non-stop episodes of &#34;House Hunters,&#34; &#34;Property Brothers,&#34; and &#34;90 Day Fiancé&#34; - I just wish they were easier to find.</p><p>One of the redeeming features of the Discovery Plus interface is its helpful recommendation feature. When visiting a show&#39;s main page there are up to 20 additional series recommendations to explore, making it easy to jump into similar programs you might like.</p><p>I was hopeful that the platform&#39;s &#34;My List&#34; would easily compile all my favorite content in one place, but it turns out that this feature doesn&#39;t let you save individual episodes. In addition to a limited &#34;Recently Watched&#34; section - which is only accessible on the &#34;For You&#34; page - there isn&#39;t a place to queue up specific episodes I want to watch over the span of a few hours. This makes the experience difficult as I have to go back and sort through shows to find episodes.</p><h2>Format support</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> does include some 4K titles for subscribers who have the necessary gear, but it&#39;s not easy to find these programs as there&#39;s no specific 4K category in the main menu.</p><p>The platform requires you to search &#34;Ultra HD&#34; to find this content. After you do this, an &#34;Ultra HD&#34; tab will appear in the results. Once you click on a 4K title, a &#34;UHD&#34; icon will appear on its page to let you know that it plays in 4K. That said, the icon may not appear on certain devices.</p><p>While most of the UHD content is limited to a few nature programs - such as &#34;Planet Earth II&#34; and BBC&#39;s &#34;Dynasties&#34; - I was surprised to find programs like &#34;NASA Mars Landing,&#34; &#34;Misfit Garage&#34; and &#34;American Titans&#34; in 4K quality. On the downside, unlike Netflix and other popular 4K services, Discovery Plus does not support <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-hdr-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HDR</a>.</p><h2>Devices and features</h2><p>Discovery Plus <a href=\"https://help.discoveryplus.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500000101182-Browsers-and-devices-supported-by-discovery-\">is compatible with most media players and smart TV platforms</a>, with the exception of PlayStation devices.</p><p>While Discovery Plus is relatively new and will likely roll out new features throughout 2021, there are already obvious faults that I hope it fixes.</p><p>One of these is the lack of offline downloads, making Discovery Plus the only major streaming service that doesn&#39;t provide this feature.</p><p>Aside from that drawback, Discovery Plus is mostly on par with other platforms thanks to its 4K content and support for up to four simultaneous streams (just like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus</a>). Its starting plan is also one of the cheapest streaming options there is, at just $5 a month. That&#39;s comparable to Apple TV Plus and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.peacocktv.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Peacock Premium</a>.</p><h2>Should you subscribe to Discovery Plus?</h2><p>Discovery Plus&#39; low price makes it a solid option for big fans of reality TV, cooking shows, nature docs, and other nonfiction programs. It&#39;s also an affordable choice if you&#39;re looking for a secondary service to supplement your primary <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-streaming-service\">streaming platform</a>, whether that be Netflix, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-streaming-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-prime-video\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Prime Video</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney Plus</a>, or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-much-is-hulu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hulu</a>. </p><p>Personally, I&#39;d tack an ad-supported <a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> plan onto a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-bundle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney Plus bundle</a>. With this combo, you&#39;ll get scripted shows and movies from Hulu and Disney Plus, sports from ESPN+, and nonfiction programs from Discovery for a total of $19 a month.</p><p>Discovery Plus, even with ads, is worth it for fans of its cable channels. The exclusive programs, in addition to its extensive on-demand library, can lead to hours of entertainment, even if there are hiccups with the interface.</p><h2>The bottom line</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ff39e493793140019e284d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"discovery plus\" height=\"880\" width=\"1173\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Discovery Plus</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><a href=\"https://www.discoveryplus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Discovery Plus</a> is still new, which gives it time to sort out its flaws, especially its limited &#34;My List&#34; feature and lack of downloads. These flaws make the catalog of shows and documentaries difficult to explore to the fullest extent. </p><p>But beyond these faults, Discovery Plus knows what its networks do best: offer entertaining and informative content about our homes, lives, history, and natural world. </p><p>Fans of scripted TV dramas and comedies will have to look elsewhere, but shows like &#34;Guy&#39;s Grocery Games,&#34; &#34;Anthony Bourdain&#39;s No Reservations,&#34; and &#34;Ghost Adventures: Cecil Hotel&#34; are binge-worthy adventures for anyone bored with fictional dramas.</p><p>For full details on how we evaluate streaming services, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-streaming-service#what-we-look-for-in-on-demand-streaming-services-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"562c5acc54c4a54a5a3642d86c60eb99\">check out our review methodology here</a>.</p><p><strong>Pros</strong>: Diverse content for fans of nonfiction TV, great for binge-watching, very affordable, tons of original programs</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: User interface is bulky, no ability to queue and save specific episodes, no offline watching, no HDR support</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"6013317088948700119fd9cc\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Free Trial for Verizon Unlimited Customers (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"60550ef41870630011aa2b27\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Monthly Plan (ad-supported) (small)</bi-shortcode><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/discovery-plus-review'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/92oiL82YED4\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Apr 2021 20:40:37 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60673a8c856cd700198a2e0e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d8d1131657f74ecf18fb51761340dfba","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn31@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-41-047_d96fbbc95962b721.webp","destWidth":1754,"destHeight":1316,"sourceBytes":87844,"destBytes":87844,"author":"insider@insider.com (Ben Blanchet)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60673a9a856cd700198a2e0f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn51@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-48-296_0620a870416a5c7d.webp","https://i.insider.com/60673c56a7d803001963e76e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn32@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-41-938_153a4103de7d4a45.webp","https://i.insider.com/60676e09a7d803001963e8e3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn9@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-56-532_e5fcc9dc43638e38.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ff39e493793140019e284d2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn74@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-50-21-475_44f073d1021d2a61.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-56-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn4@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-44-100_949f831bfb06fabb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn59@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-46-301_8fa5f5010017801f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-912_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=92oiL82YED4:23m4BG8Ny0o:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn64@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-43-616_7adba9ffc8c5ac76.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/92oiL82YED4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn40@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-50-716_fca2475ba9548053.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425373840},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"What if the Earth spun sideways on its axis","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/earth-axis-spun-sideways-extreme-summer-winter-seasons-2019-7","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/RyEMHAql-jZbcmOYf.html\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"What if the Earth spun sideways on its axis\" style=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/earth\">Earth</a> spins on a 23.5-degree tilt, which is responsible for the seasons as we know them.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>But if Earth&#39;s axis tilted to 90 degrees, extreme seasons would cause intense <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/climate-change\">climate change</a> on every continent. </strong></li>\n<li><strong>During the summer, the Northern Hemisphere would experience nearly 24 hours of sunlight for months, which could <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/changes-earth-artic-ice-melted-animated-map-nasa-2017-3\">melt ice caps</a>, raise <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/sea-levels\">sea levels</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-us-looks-like-if-earth-ice-melted-animated-map-2017-5\">flood coastal cities</a>.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>In the winter, it would get nearly 24 hours of complete darkness, killing plants, ecosystems, and crops.</strong></li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em>Following is a transcript of the video.</em></p><p>Early in the history of our solar system, something mysteriously knocked Earth slightly off its axis. So today we tilt at 23.5 degrees. But what would happen if we tilted even more? What if Earth spun sideways on its axis? Well, it wouldn&#39;t take long before utter chaos ensued.</p><p>One of the most important consequences of Earth&#39;s axial tilt is the seasons. Seasons happen because the tilt points different parts of the planet toward the sun at different times of the year. But the tilt also means that different parts of the globe receive different amounts of sunlight during each season. And that&#39;s where a more extreme tilt starts to cause problems. Right now, during the summer in the Northern Hemisphere, places far north, like Utqiagvik, Alaska, receive 24 hours of sunlight for 82 days straight. Because Earth is tilted far enough on its axis that as the planet rotates, Utqiagvik never leaves direct sunlight. On the other hand, the contiguous US receives a max of 17 hours a day, because after that it rotates out of daytime sunlight and into night. But if we tilted Earth&#39;s axis even more, to 90 degrees, the US would get sunlight 24/7, around the clock, for months on end. And it&#39;s not just the US; the entire Northern Hemisphere would be like this.</p><p>At first, animals would take advantage of the extra light to find and eat more food, just like Alaskan birds, which feed their chicks extra nutrition in the summer, resulting in faster-growing babies than their southern counterparts. And plant growth would explode since they get their energy directly from sunlight. Farms in northern Alaska, for example, grow cabbages the size of rottweilers in the summer.</p><p>But while animals and plants would thrive, humans wouldn&#39;t. We evolved to be active during the day and sleep at night. But if we were exposed to unending sunlight, our brains would stop producing the hormone melatonin, which we need to sleep at night. And that could lead to sleep deprivation, depression, and, ultimately, a more severe, chronic version of these symptoms called seasonal affective disorder, which already affects 9% of Alaskans, compared to just 6% of the entire United States.</p><p>But that&#39;s less of a worry than the floods. Temperatures at the North Pole would more than double, to 38 degrees Celsius from 15.5 degrees Celsius. That&#39;s hotter than temperatures at the equator today. As a result, Greenland&#39;s ice cap would melt, causing sea levels to rise by 7 meters, and flood nearly every coastal city on Earth. Say goodbye to New York, Copenhagen, and Tokyo. To make matters worse, the warmer seas would trigger stronger and more frequent hurricanes, which form when seawater evaporates at the surface.</p><p>And the weather wouldn&#39;t get better when winter comes six months later. Out of reach of the sun&#39;s direct beams for months at a time, the hemisphere would get colder than any winter on record. Swirls of frigid air, called a polar vortex, which are normally dissipated by warm air in the tropics, could travel all the way down to the equator. Imagine blizzards in Florida, Brazil, Kenya! And all those thriving plants, they&#39;d die from a lack of sunlight. Agriculture would collapse as ecosystems crumble and mass extinctions pile up.</p><p>And there would be even more floods, because meanwhile, the Southern Hemisphere is getting toasty and the South Pole is home to 90% of the world&#39;s ice. The constant sunlight would raise its temperature to 38 degrees Celsius from -28 degrees Celsius, melting the ice and raising sea levels by a whopping 61 meters. That&#39;s almost as tall as the Leaning Tower of Pisa. Greenland&#39;s flood would look like a puddle in comparison.</p><p>So all in all, while a few extra hours in the summer sun would be nice, let&#39;s leave the extra seasons to Alaska and be glad the Earth is tilted exactly as it is.</p><p><em>EDITOR&#39;S NOTE: This video was originally published in July 2019.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 12:49:33","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:33","title":"Police officer killed and suspect shot dead after vehicle attack at US Capitol","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-capitol-is-on-lockdown-over-an-external-security-threat-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60675acfa7d803001963e82a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Capitol car crash\" height=\"888\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Capitol Police officers near a car that crashed into a barrier on Capitol Hill on April 2.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Scott J. Applewhite/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The United States Capitol locked down on Friday afternoon after a car rammed into a barricade.</li>\n<li>Capitol Police confirmed that the car hit two officers in front of the barricade.</li>\n<li>One officer died and the other has been hospitalized. The driver was shot and killed.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A Capitol Police officer died and another was injured after someone rammed a car into a barricade outside the US Capitol on Friday, Yogananda Pittman, the acting Capitol Police chief, said at a press conference.</p><p>After hitting the barricade, the driver &#34;exited the car with a knife in hand&#34; and &#34;lunged&#34; at the officers before one of them opened fire, killing the driver, she added. Multiple news outlets, including <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Tom_Winter/status/1378070336441176066\">NBC News</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/jimsciutto/status/1378082314819895327\">CNN</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/02/us/us-capitol-lockdown-police-attack.html?referringSource=articleShare\">The New York Times</a>, identified the driver as Noah Green, 25, of Indiana.</p><p>Capitol Police also identified the fallen officer as William &#34;Billy&#34; Evans, an 18-year veteran of the department.</p><p>&#34;It is with a very, very heavy heart that I announce one of our officers has succumbed to his injuries,&#34; Pittman said. &#34;I just ask that the public keep the U.S. Capitol Police and their families in your prayers.&#34;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-U.S. Capitol Police  (@CapitolPolice) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1378078115495301120?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 2, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The Capitol went into lockdown earlier on Friday after Capitol Police sent out an alert telling people in the complex to stay indoors because of an &#34;external security threat.&#34; Congress was in recess, and neither the House nor the Senate was in session.</p><p>Videos posted to social media by reporters in the building showed a heavy police presence outside the Capitol. At one point, a helicopter was seen landing on the premises, and the National Guard was deployed after the incident.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Jake Sherman  (@JakeSherman) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1378031711766863872?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 2, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Jake Sherman  (@JakeSherman) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1378033434082344972?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 2, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Witnesses reported that a car crashed into the barricade outside the Capitol shortly after 1 p.m. ET.</p><p>A pair of stretchers was also seen by a reporter as first responders arrived on the scene.</p><p>For hours, members of the National Guard and armed Capitol Police officers lined a perimeter blocking everyone, including reporters, from getting closer.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60676f2fa7d803001963e8e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"US Capitol\" height=\"2016\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tina Sfondeles/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>A Capitol Police officer told Insider he was moved from a hard squad to help with the lockdown. He said officers were armed with M4 rifles, in addition to their Glocks. The officer said the lockdown was longer than expected, as authorities sought more information about the incident.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60676f60856cd700198a2f7c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"US Capitol\" height=\"2016\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Haltiwanger/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The lockdown was lifted just after 3 p.m. ET. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi&#39;s deputy chief of staff said she ordered the flags at the Capitol to be flown at half-staff in light of the events.</p><p>Friday&#39;s incident comes less than three months after hundreds of former President Donald Trump&#39;s <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-siege-module\">supporters stormed the Capitol</a> to interrupt a joint session of Congress that was underway to finalize President Joe Biden&#39;s election win. At least five people, including a Capitol Police officer, died during the insurrection.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
